item.title: Jury awards $1.68 billion to women in James Toback sexual abuse case
item.dc:creator: Susan Haigh | The Associated Press
Susan Haigh | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: The Leisure Seeker (Ella & John) Premiere ‚Äì 74th Venice Film Festival
media:content.media:description: James Toback walks the red carpet ahead of the ‚ÄúThe Leisure Seeker (Ella & John)‚Äù screening during the 74th Venice Film Festival at Sala Grande on Sept. 3, 2017, in Venice, Italy.

item.excerpt: A jury awarded $1.68 billion in damages to 40 women¬†who accused writer and director James Toback¬†of sexual abuse and other crimes over a span of 35 years.
item.description:
A New York jury on Wednesday awarded $1.68 billion in damages to 40 women¬†who accused writer and director James Toback¬†of sexual abuse and other crimes over a span of 35 years, according to lawyers representing the plaintiffs.

The decision stems from a lawsuit filed in Manhattan in 2022 after New York state¬†instituted a one-year window¬†for people to file lawsuits over sexual assault claims even if they took place decades ago.

It marks one of the largest jury awards since the advent of the #MeToo movement, as well as in New York state history, said attorney Brad Beckworth, of the law firm Nix Patterson LLP, in an interview. The plaintiffs, he said, believe such a large verdict will send a message to powerful individuals ‚Äúwho don’t treat women appropriately.‚Äù

The court had not yet released documentation of the verdict as of Wednesday night. Beckworth said the verdict included $280 million in compensatory damages and $1.4 billion for punitive damages to the plaintiffs.

‚ÄúThis verdict is about justice,‚Äù Beckworth said in a statement. ‚ÄúBut more importantly, It‚Äôs about taking power back from the abusers ‚Äî and their and enablers ‚Äî and returning it to those he tried to control and silence.‚Äù

Beckworth said the abuse took place between 1979 and 2014.

Toback was nominated for an Oscar for writing 1991‚Ä≤s ‚ÄúBugsy,‚Äù and his career in Hollywood has spanned more than 40 years. Accusations that he engaged in years of sexual abuse surfaced in late 2017 as the #MeToo movement gained attention. They were first reported by the Los Angeles Times.

In 2018, Los Angeles prosecutors said the statutes of limitations had expired in five cases they reviewed, and declined to bring criminal charges against Toback.

The plaintiffs then filed a lawsuit in New York a few days after the state’s Adult Survivors Act went into effect. The lawyers said they discovered a pattern of Toback attempting to lure young women on the streets of New York into meeting him by falsely promising roles in his films and then subjecting them to sexual acts, threats and psychological coercion.

Mary Monahan, a lead plaintiff in the case, called the jury award ‚Äúvalidation‚Äù for her and the other women.

‚ÄúFor decades, I carried this trauma in silence, and today, a jury believed me. Believed us. That changes everything,‚Äù she said in a statement. ‚ÄúThis verdict is more than a number ‚Äî it‚Äôs a declaration. We are not disposable. We are not liars. We are not collateral damage in someone else‚Äôs power trip. The world knows now what we‚Äôve always known: what he did was real.‚Äù

Toback, 80, who most recently had represented himself, denied numerous times in court documents that he ‚Äúcommitted any sexual offense‚Äù and that ‚Äúany sexual encounter or contact between Plaintiffs and Defendant was consensual.‚Äù

He also argued that New York’s law extending the statute of limitations on sexual abuse cases violated his constitutional rights.

A message sent to an email address listed for him seeking comment was not immediately answered.

In January, the judge in the case entered a default judgment against Toback, who had failed to appear in court when ordered to do so. The judge then scheduled a trial for only damages last month to determine how much Toback had to pay the women.

item.title: Wife of Weezer band member shot by police as officers searched LA neighborhood
item.dc:creator: Karla Rendon and G√©nesis Miranda Miramontes
Karla Rendon and G√©nesis Miranda Miramontes

media:content.media:title: eagle rock arrest 4825
media:content.media:description: Police opened fire on an armed woman after a hit-and-run suspect ran into her Eagle Rock home while trying to evade officers.

item.excerpt: Three people were arrested on Tuesday afternoon following a hit-and-run crash on the 134 Freeway that later led to an officer-involved shooting in Eagle Rock.
item.description:
The wife of a Weezer band member was shot by police as officers searched for three people involved in a hit-and-run crash on a freeway in a residential Los Angeles neighborhood.

Jillian Shriner, wife of Weezer bassist Scott Shriner, was injured in the shooting, which unfolded during a neighborhood police search.

The chain of events began after authorities responded to a three-vehicle crash on the 134 Freeway in Eagle Rock near Figueroa Street just after 3 p.m. in the San Gabriel Valley community east of Los Angeles. The California Highway Patrol said a driver and passengers abandoned the car following the crash and ran into a neighborhood near Eagle Vista Drive and Figueroa Street.

One of the three men involved in the hit-and-run surrendered. NBC Los Angeles’ NewsChopper 4 was over the scene during the arrest and captured a man in his boxers being taken into custody.

During the search for the other individuals, an armed woman came out of her home on Eagle Vista Drive. Police officers fired at the woman, identified Wednesday by the LAPD as Jillian Shriner, who was struck in the shoulder.

Shriner was arrested about an hour later and booked on suspicion of attempted murder. She allegedly pointed a handgun at officers and did not abide by police commands to drop the weapon, the LAPD said.

According to Det. Megan Aguilar, public information officer for the LAPD, the woman did not know the subjects of the search.

She was treated for non-life-threatening injuries.

The identities of those who were arrested have not been released. Details about whether the two other individuals sought by police were not immediately available.

item.title: How to vote for your favorite new Lay's potato chip flavor
item.dc:creator: Andrew V. Pestano
Andrew V. Pestano

media:content.media:title: Lay's potato chips pack seen in a Target superstore

item.excerpt: From April 21 until June 13, snackers can taste and vote on the three finalist flavors, each created by snack lovers from across the country.
item.description:
The Lay‚Äôs potato chip company is asking fans to decide on a future flavor for its lineup. The finalists for the ‚ÄúDo Us a Flavor‚Äù contest have been announced and this year‚Äôs competition comes with a $1 million reward.

The three final flavors “are hitting the shelves near you,” Lay’s contest website reads. Voting kicks off on April 21 and runs through June 13.

During that time, chip snackers can visit local stores to taste and vote on the three finalist flavors, each created by snack lovers from across the country with the help of Lay’s experts.

The finalists are:

  • Valentina & Lime ‚Äî a flavor made from Valentina hot sauce and lime juice
  • Korean-Style Fried Chicken ‚Äî a spicy and sweet chip inspired by South Korean street food
  • Bacon Grilled Cheese ‚Äî a chip inspired by the nostalgic sandwich recipe of the finalist’s father

The flavor with the most votes at the end of the contest will be crowned the winner and the creator will walk away with the million-dollar grand prize. The two runners-up won‚Äôt leave empty-handed either, each earning $50,000.

While the chips are only available for a limited time, one lucky flavor may become a permanent part of the Lay‚Äôs lineup. As Lay’s put it: “The future of snacking is up to you!”

item.title: Mom's rant about kids' play spaces opening at 10 a.m. is sparking a revolution
item.dc:creator: Rachel Paula Abrahamson | TODAY
Rachel Paula Abrahamson | TODAY
item.excerpt: One Florida mom is asking the question every parent‚Äôs been dying to scream into the void: Why do children‚Äôs play spaces open so ridiculously late?
item.description:
One Florida mom is asking the question every parent‚Äôs been dying to scream into the void: Why do children‚Äôs play spaces open so ridiculously late?

‚ÄúY‚Äôall, we have been up since 5:15,‚Äù Ronsina Ray ‚Äî mother to a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old ‚Äî began a recent TikTok video. ‚ÄúCan somebody please explain to me why the stuff for kids opens at 10 or 11 o‚Äôclock in the morning?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve lived five different lives. I‚Äôve cooked two meals. I‚Äôve watched 16 hours of TV. I have showed my head, shoulders, knees and toes. I done labeled every body part. I done shapes, colors, letters,‚Äù Ray, 31, continued. ‚ÄúWe done went to the potty three times. We‚Äôve had four snacks. We went outside for an hour ‚Äî and you‚Äôre still not open? … By the time y‚Äôall open, we done made it to high school graduation.‚Äù

During an interview with TODAY.com, Ray points out another issue: the hours clash with many nap schedules.

‚ÄúBy the time we get there, my kids, who‚Äôve been awake since 5, are cranky and fighting and it’s time to leave,‚Äù Ray says.

Jokingly, she suggests creating her own ‚Äúlittle space‚Äù for parents and children to gather first thing in the morning. 

‚ÄúI‚Äôm picturing the old McDonald‚Äôs with an indoor play area,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI can drink some coffee, my kids can play and we can have some breakfast. Wouldn‚Äôt that be nice?‚Äù

If the comments on Ray‚Äôs TikTok are any indication, she may have the beginnings of a successful new business venture. 

  • ‚Äú10am is DINNER TIME,‚Äù one person wrote.
  • ‚ÄúThe library opening at 10am is seriously criminal.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAnd then I take you at 10 but you fall asleep in the car for 5 minutes on the way home and ruin my whole goddamn day.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúI have been asking this question since becoming a mom. I mean by the time they open, 1/2 my day is done!‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúLowe‚Äôs opens at 7. Used to take the kids and let them explore the model kitchens and appliances.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt have kids but one time I saw a LINE of parents and kids waiting at the door of the indoor playground at 9:58AM. They looked STRESSED.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAt this point give me the keys and we can get it set up early and popping. My kids would be free employees in exchange for early fun.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWe have a new play place that opens at 7am and I was like welp you get all my money.”

This story first appeared on TODAY.com. More from TODAY:

item.title: Not an April Fool's prank: KFC's fried chicken-flavored toothpaste sold out
item.dc:creator: Andrew V. Pestano
Andrew V. Pestano

media:content.media:title: 04092025 KFC Fried Chicken Toothbrush Toothpaste NATL
media:content.media:description: If you dreamed of brushing your teeth with a delicious blend of 11 herbs and spices, you‚Äôre out of luck as KFC‚Äôs toothpaste sold out in a matter of days.

item.excerpt: What seemed like a prank at first became a successful marketing ploy as KFC's fried chicken-flavored toothpaste has ‚Äî you guessed it ‚Äî sold out.
item.description:
What seemed like an April Fool’s prank at first glance became a successful marketing promotion as KFC’s fried chicken-flavored toothpaste and accompanying toothbrush have ‚Äî you guessed it ‚Äî sold out.

KFC announced the fried chicken dental concoction on April 1. While many assumed it was a joke, the house Colonel Sanders built was adamant the collaboration with Hismile was no laughing matter.

“Not a prank. It‚Äôs here. And it‚Äôs Finger Lickin‚Äô Good,” KFC wrote on Instagram.

Many commented on the post sharing disappointment ‚Äî seemingly because they failed to read the caption or do some follow-up research.

“I’m too tired. I thought this was real. How dare u kfc,” one Instagram user commented.

“Awh man I wish this was real üíî,” another user wrote.

KFC wanted to reassure its followers by replying: “It‚Äôs real we promise ü§û visit the link in our caption üòä”

“This toothpaste is like biting into a crispy, hot, juicy piece of KFC Original Recipe Chicken. Bring the unmistakable taste of crispy, golden perfection straight to your toothbrush for a full-on flavour takeover,” Hismile’s website reads.

But as the toothpaste that cost $13 and the separate toothbrush that cost $59 recently sold out, the disappointment will continue for many who wished to brush their teeth with the iconic flavor blend of 11 herbs and spices.

More dental coverage:

Food & Drink Mar 19

Is sparkling water bad for your teeth? Dentists weigh in

Health & Wellness Sep 16, 2024

Menopause can bring on dental problems, but you can protect your mouth

Health & Wellness Apr 25, 2024

When should you not brush your teeth? Dentist goes viral for sharing 3 surprising situations

KFC is known for eye-catching marketing stunts. A Colonel Sanders look-alike breached United Nations security in 2009, and met with former UN General Assembly President Ali Treki.

While the idea of fried chicken-flavored toothpaste may be good for laughs, the novelty paste doesn‚Äôt contain fluoride ‚Äî an important naturally occurring mineral that helps prevent cavities and strengthen enamel for healthy teeth.

item.title: LeBron James teams up with Barbie for new Ken doll
item.dc:creator: Max Molski
Max Molski

media:content.media:title: LeBron James
media:content.media:description: A look at the LeBron James Ken doll.

item.excerpt: LeBron James will be the first pro athlete to get a Ken doll in his likeness as part of a partnership with Mattel.
item.description:
LeBron James is going from Crypto.com Arena to a “Mojo Dojo Casa House.”

Mattel, the makers of Barbie, announced on Wednesday that the Los Angeles Lakers superstar will be the first professional athlete to get his own Ken doll in his likeness.

James will become Mattel’s first “Kenbassador” in a collaboration with the LeBron James Family Foundation, with the hopes of “inspiring and contributing to a better world for all”

“As a young kid, I was fortunate to have role models who not only inspired me but also showed me what‚Äôs possible through hard work and dedication,‚Äù James said in a press release. “Now, as an adult, I understand how vital it is for young people to have positive figures to look up to.

“That‚Äôs why partnering with Barbie to release the LeBron James Kenbassadors doll is such an honor. It‚Äôs an opportunity to recognize the powerful impact of role models who instill confidence, inspire dreams, and show kids that they, too, can achieve greatness.”

When does the LeBron James Ken doll come out?

The LeBron James Kenbassador doll hit shelves on Monday, April 14. Cost is $75 per doll.

In-store availability includes select Target locations, while online purchases can be made at Target, Amazon, Walmart and Mattel Creations.

Mattel will donate a copy of James’ children’s book, “I Am More Than,” to Save the Children for every doll sold at Target and Target.com from April 14-19, up to 5,000 copies.

Additionally, Barbie is making a donation to the LeBron James Family Foundation to “help inspire the limitless potential of every child and invest more resources to create generational change for the kids and families of James‚Äô hometown” of Akron, Ohio.

‚ÄúFor the LeBron James Family Foundation and the families we serve, this is so much more than a doll. It represents the reality that a kid from anywhere can make a difference,‚Äù said Michele Campbell, executive director of the LeBron James Family Foundation. ‚ÄúWe are incredibly honored to partner with Barbie to continue inspiring the next generation and to celebrate LeBron‚Äôs unwavering commitment to his community by giving back through the LeBron James Kenbassadors doll.‚Äù

Closer look at the LeBron James Ken doll

James has been turned into an action figure before. But unlike the toy versions from McFarlane Toys and Starting Lineup that depict him in an NBA uniform, the Ken doll features an adjustable, multi-accessary outfit akin to a pregame tunnel look.

The dolls comes clad in a custom varsity jacket over the LeBron James Family Foundation‚Äôs signature “We Are Family” T-shirt, Nike Terminator High sneakers, Beats headphones, sunglasses, a fanny pack, a watch and his perennial “I Promise” band.

The doll not only captures James’ style, but also his height. It will be one inch taller than the standard Ken doll and come in larger, custom packaging.

LeBron career in review

The NBA's all-time leading scorer has left a mark on the game of basketball ‚Äî and in the world of entertainment and fasion.

LeBron James Mar 30

How LeBron James ended up investing in a tequila company

LeBron James Mar 4

Inside the numbers: LeBron James and his historic path to 50,000 NBA points

NBA Jan 17

LeBron James turned down $10 million from Reebok when he was 18 years old

Why is Mattel celebrating Ken?

Ken, Barbie’s longtime best friend and supporter, will celebrate his 65th anniversary in 2026.

“We are excited to bring fans a new presentation of Ken that celebrates LeBron as a role model, his icon status, lasting impact on culture and dedication to setting a positive example for the next generation to reach their limitless potential,” said Krista Berger, senior vice president of Barbie and global head of dolls at Mattel.

Mattel said that, along with the LeBron James doll, it will honor other Kenbassadors.

item.description:
It’s an early Easter for fans of donuts.

Krispy Kreme on Monday unveiled its newest assortment of Easter-themed donuts, featuring three new flavors and one fan favorite that is returning.

The first newcomer is a “Bunny Basket” donut, which is based on Krispy Kreme’s original glazed flavor, dipped in chocolate icing, decorated with chocolate flavored buttercream and topped with a confectionery bunny.

Next is the “Marshmallow” bunny donut. This is an unglazed donut, filled with marshmallow creme, dipped in pastel yellow icing and topped with a bunny face and confectionery ears.

Hop into sweetness! üê∞ The Hoppy Easter Collection is here, featuring four festive flavors everybunny will love!

The last new flavor is the “Bouncing Bunny” donut. This is also original glazed, dipped in pastel blue icing and sprinkles and topped with a bouncing bunny.

Returning is the strawberry iced donut with sprinkles.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre passing on the eggs this Easter and instead hopping into the holiday with all-new bunny-themed doughnuts that are almost too cute to eat. Almost!” Dave Skena, Krispy Kreme chief growth officer, said in a release. “And ‚Ä¶ you don‚Äôt have to hunt for these doughnuts; just hop to a Krispy Kreme shop near you.”

item.title: ‚ÄòWhite Lotus' creator Mike White takes aim at composer who left show amid alleged feud
item.dc:creator: Mirna Alsharif | NBC News
Mirna Alsharif | NBC News

media:content.media:title: WHITE-LOTUS
media:content.media:description: White Lotus creator Mike White; composer Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer.

item.excerpt: "The White Lotus" creator Mike White did not hold back when asked about an alleged feud with composer Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer.
item.description:
“The White Lotus” creator Mike White did not hold back when asked about an alleged feud with composer Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer, calling Tapia de Veer’s decision to speak to the media days before the show’s season finale “a b—- move.”

The actor and director dialed into “The Howard Stern Show” Tuesday where he was asked about what happened with Tapia de Veer. The composer publicly announced in an interview with the New York Times that he would not be returning for a fourth season of the hit HBO series, and hinted at strife between him and White stemming back to the first season.

“I just don’t think he respected me. He, like, wants people to know that he’s edgy and dark and I’m, I don’t know, like, I watch reality TV,” White said to Stern.

Tapia de Veer, who won three Emmys for his work on the show, told the Times in the interview published Wednesday that he had creative disagreements and fights with White, adding that the creator initially wanted music that lacked edge for the first season’s theme.

“He had a temp score, a song that is more like something you would listen to in Ibiza, in some clubby place with a chill, sexy vibe,” Tapia de Veer told the outlet. “And there‚Äôs literally no edge to it. It‚Äôs a good song; it‚Äôs nice music. There‚Äôs just absolutely no ‚Äî whatever you find in the ‘White Lotus’ music, the relationships with the characters ‚Äî there‚Äôs none of that. It‚Äôs just nice background music.”

When the show’s third season premiered on Feb. 16, social media exploded with audience members who noted the discontinuation of the theme song from the first two seasons, which was replaced by music that paid homage to Thailand, where the season was set.

Tapia de Veer wanted to humor the public’s longing for the familiar war cry melody by weaving it into a longer version of the Season 3 theme, but said White refused due to their fights, the Times reported. The composer uploaded the longer version to his YouTube last month.

White, on the other hand, said he never fought with the composer.

“We never really even fought, I don’t know what ‚Äî he says we feuded, I don’t think I ever had a fight with him except maybe some emails,” White said on “The Howard Stern Show.”

“But it was just basically, like, me giving him notes, you know? Like I just don’t think he liked to have to go through the process of getting notes from me or wanting revisions or whatever,” he said.

White said Tapia de Veer is not a team player “and wanted to do it his way,” adding that he was “thrown” that the composer spoke to the press “to s*** on” him and the show ahead of the finale.

“It was kind of a b—- move,” he said.

White also said he felt the composer was making a big deal out of differences in opinion, but highlighted that he thinks Tapia de Veer is “very talented.”

Stern weighed in on the reported feud, telling White that Tapia de Veer should follow his vision for the music as he is the show’s creator.

“Why quit a smash hit show because you got some notes and some differences, just f—ing work it out,” Stern said about the composer.

Television Apr 3

‚ÄòThe White Lotus'¬†cast's surprising salaries revealed

Television Apr 7

Mike White teases where he wants Season 4 of ‚ÄòWhite Lotus' to take place

After the radio show aired Tuesday, Tapia de Veer wrote on his X account that he’s “gonna have to tell the full story now.”

“I did try to avoid it, dude…,” the composer wrote.

In an update on Tuesday afternoon, Tapia de Veer shared a screenshot of what appears to be an Instagram reel with the caption, “the white lotus composer QUIT because mike white made him cut the second half of this song and I will never forgive mike for as long as I live.”

The composer said he “learned a lot about how they work a BS campaign that builds towards an interview where the guy capitalizes on the lies they spread.”

“I‚Äôm glad I archive all texts and emails dude, they all have dates and stuff you know, those can be verified it‚Äôs not just talking… :),” he wrote on X.

This story first appeared on NBCNews.com. More from NBC News:

item.title: ‚ÄòJurassic Park' has thoughts about dire wolves being brought back from extinction
item.dc:creator: Andrew V. Pestano
Andrew V. Pestano

media:content.media:title: 04082025 Jurassic Park Dire Wolves NATL
media:content.media:description: Left: Dire wolves Romulus and Remus at three-months-old. Right: Picture taken at Islands of Adventure in Universal Studios.

item.excerpt: Were scientists behind the de-extinction of dire wolves so preoccupied with whether or not they could, that they didn't stop to think if they should?
item.description:
The once-extinct dire wolf species, popularized in HBO’s “Game of Thrones,” has been brought back. But were Colossal Biosciences scientists behind the de-extinction so preoccupied with whether or not they could, that they didn’t stop to think if they should?

The Dallas-based biotech company on Monday announced the large canines that went extinct nearly 13,000 years ago were partly revived by breeding three wolf pups that carry genes of their long-lost ancestors.

The de-extinction revelation generated curiosity, concern and commentary ‚Äî including from a “Jurassic Park” social media account.

“We see no possible way this could go wrong,” the “Jurassic World” account wrote on X.

The tongue-in-cheek comment is a nod to the cautionary tale in Steven Spielberg’s 1993 classic film “Jurassic Park” in which the hubris of humanity’s science leads to destruction and chaos.

Seeing as Colossal Biosciences is also working to bring back the extinct prehistoric woolly mammoth and dodo species, it’s not unreasonable to imagine a world in which further developments in de-extinction lead to more “Jurassic Park” references.

However, the dire wolf comeback isn’t a full revival of the species. The DNA from the fossils of dire wolves was extracted and used to edit the genes of gray wolves. Those edited cells were used to create embryos that were transferred to surrogates, leading to an indirect rebirth of an extinct species.

The three pups, who were born six months ago, are named Romulus, Remus and Khaleesi. They feature traits of dire wolves ‚Äî including a larger, stronger body and a longer, fuller coat with light pigmentation.

More prehistoric news:

Animals Mar 27

Venus flytrap wasp? Scientists uncover ancient insect preserved in amber that snatched its prey

Australia Mar 12

School discovers 200-million year old dinosaur fossils in parking lot

Jul 17, 2024

Stegosaurus fossil fetches nearly $45 million, setting record for dinosaur auctions

University at Buffalo biologist Vincent Lynch told NBC News the results only bring back the exterior semblance of an extinct species. Additionally, Lynch stresses this latest effort doesn‚Äôt mean dire wolves are coming back to North American grasslands any time soon.

‚ÄúAll you can do now is make something look superficially like something else‚Äù‚Äî not fully revive extinct species, he said.

Perhaps with more time and scientific breakthroughs, we’ll see the full return of a once-extinct species. As we know, life finds a way.

Mike Gavin and The Associated Press contributed to this report.

item.title: How Eminem's daughter Hailie Jade honored him with baby name
item.dc:creator: Sydney Kerr | E! Online
Sydney Kerr | E! Online

media:content.media:title: Eminem and Hailie Jade
media:content.media:description: Eminem, left, and daughter Hailie Jade, right.

item.excerpt: Eminem‚Äôs daughter Hailie Jade honored her father¬†in the¬†name of her and husband Evan McClintock‚Äôs son, whom they welcomed April 4.¬†
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online.

Hailie Jade was not afraid to turn to her family for the perfect baby name.

So, when Eminem’s daughter and her husband Evan McClintock welcomed their son on April 4, they took inspiration from the ‚ÄúLose Yourself‚Äù rapper (real name Marshall Mathers) by naming him Elliot Marshall McClintock, with his middle name being a nod to his grandfather.

Eminem has been along for the ride as he prepared to become a first-time grandfather. In fact, Jade ‚Äî whose mom is Kim Scott ‚Äî announced her pregnancy in her dad‚Äôs music video for ‚ÄúTemporary‚Äù featuring Skylar Gray, a track dedicated to his daughter.

The heartfelt video shows footage of her growing up and the love he has for his little girl. At the end of the video, Jade gifts him a Detroit Lions jersey with ‚Äú#1 Grandpa‚Äù on the back alongside a sonogram for her baby, leaving Eminem shocked. And the 29-year-old previously detailed what it was like to share that moment with him.

Music & Musicians Dec 9, 2024

Eminem changes lyric about mom Debbie Nelson after her death

Oct 3, 2024

Eminem reacts to daughter Hailie Jade's pregnancy

READ: Eminem’s Pregnant Daughter Hailie Jade Shares Sweet Baby Bump Photos With Husband Evan McClintock

“He was like, ‚ÄòAre you trying to call me old?” Jade shared on her podcast “Just a Little Shady” in October about breaking the news to her dad. ‚ÄúThen I hold up the ultrasound picture and he was like, ‘Oh my god. Wait, this is real? This is happening?'”

At the end of the video, Jade shares her love for her dad in a heartfelt note.

“Dad, I got this card a few years ago & held onto it & now feels like the perfect time to give you it,” it read. “Thank you for everything you do & always being there for all of us girls. You truly are the best dad in the world. Love you forever + 100 million dollars forever & always. [Love] Bean.”

The duo continues to show their support for one another. During Jade and McClintock‚Äôs wedding last May, the ‚ÄúMockingbird‚Äù rapper was by her side in an intimate wedding and sharing a father-daughter dance together at the Battle-Creek, Michigan, ceremony.

‚ÄúLaughs & smiles were had, & so much love was felt,” Jade gushed in a May 2024 Instagram post. “Evan and I are feeling so grateful for all of the family & friends that traveled to support us and be a part of this new chapter of our lives as husband & wife.”

item.title: Masters Tournament concession prices remain low: Here's how much it all costs
item.dc:creator: Logan Reardon
Logan Reardon

media:content.media:title: The Masters ‚Äì Preview Day One
media:content.media:description: Patrons line up for concessions during a practice round prior to the 2024 Masters Tournament at Augusta National Golf Club on April 8, 2024 in Augusta, Georgia.

item.excerpt: Despite rising costs nationwide, you can still try all of the iconic food items at the 2025 Masters for an affordable price.
item.description:
Prices are rising across the country, but one cost has remained steady: food at the Masters Tournament.

Concessions at the Masters are always a hot topic, and inflation still hasn’t hit Augusta for 2025.

Prices for the concession stands have surfaced as spectators arrive for this week’s action. And, without fail, almost nothing has changed.

Masters tournament Apr 1

When is the Masters? Schedule, qualifiers, broadcast info

Masters tournament Apr 10, 2024

Who has won the most Masters? Golfers with multiple green jackets from Augusta

Food prices at the Masters Tournament in Augusta, Georgia

Fresh mixed fruit, up from $2 to $2.50, is the only price change from 2024 to 2025. The most expensive items for sale are white wine, domestic beer, imported beer and Crow’s Nest craft beer, which cost $6 each. Sandwich prices still range from $1.50 to $3 and you can get breakfast for $2 to $3.

Here’s the full menu, which adds up to $77 for one of every item:

The signature items on the menu — egg salad and pimento cheese sandwiches — cost just $1.50, as they have 2002 (!). There’s one new item on the menu, the savory tomato pie, which is available for $3.

The snack menu includes plain and BBQ chips ($1.50), peanuts ($1.50), southern cheese straws ($2), cookies ($1.50), Georgia pecan caramel popcorn ($2) and Georgia peach ice cream sandwiches ($3).

The 2025 Masters begins with the opening round on Thursday, April 10, and concludes on Sunday, April 13.

item.title: Ms. Rachel welcomes her second child, a baby girl
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang | NBC News
Marlene Lenthang | NBC News

media:content.media:title: TODAY ‚Äì Season 73
media:content.media:description: Ms. Rachel on Tuesday, Sept. 24, 2024.

item.excerpt: YouTube baby whisperer¬†Ms. Rachel¬†and her husband have welcomed their second child, Susannah, via surrogate.
item.description:
YouTube baby whisperer Ms. Rachel has welcomed her second child ‚Äî a baby girl.

Rachel Griffin Accurso announced on Instagram that she and her husband, Aron, had welcomed a baby girl named Susannah via surrogate.

“We are so in love!” she wrote in a post on Tuesday. “Sometimes timing isn‚Äôt what you plan, and the road to get there is bumpier than you expect, but when you hold your little ones, you know‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm meant to be your mama.”

She also shared a sweet photo of her cuddling her sleeping little one on a couch.

Accurso explained in the post that she was “unable to carry this pregnancy for medical reasons.”

“We were blessed to have a surrogate who gave us the most precious gift possible. We are now all family forever. We have immense gratitude and a deep bond. It‚Äôs been a truly beautiful experience. I‚Äôm in awe of her,” she continued. 

She ended the post with a message of love to her husband: “Aron ‚Äî Thank you for being the best husband and dada!”

Susannah is the couple’s second child. They also share a 7-year-old son named Thomas.

Last year, Accurso revealed her son was born after a miscarriage. She shared a touching post singing a song with the lyrics “Rainbow baby dream come true.” The term “rainbow baby” refers to a baby who is born following a miscarriage, stillbirth, or neonatal death.

Accurso is known for making educational videos for babies and toddlers, singing songs, and helping them build language.

She and her husband created their YouTube channel after they said they couldn‚Äôt find the right resources to help with their son‚Äôs speech delay.

“His first word was at 2 years and 8 months and it was ‚Äòmama‚Äô and I had waited for that for so long,” Accurso previously told “TODAY.” “As a parent, you want to do anything you can to help them, and it‚Äôs not our fault when our child has a speech delay. A lot of things I teach are things I wish I had known for my son.”

Accurso has taken a hiatus from the YouTube channel, with her last video posted in January. In March, she said the break was due to family matters.

item.title: Clem Burke, multifaceted drummer of iconic rock group Blondie, has died
item.dc:creator: Hallie Golden | The Associated Press
Hallie Golden | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: 2023 Coachella Valley Music And Arts Festival ‚Äì Weekend 2 ‚Äì Day 1
media:content.media:description: Drummer Clem Burke of Blondie performs onstage at the 2023 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival on April 21, 2023, in Indio, California.

item.excerpt: The band said in a statement on its website Monday that he died from cancer, but no additional details were provided.
item.description:
Clem Burke, whose versatile drumming propelled the iconic rock group Blondie during its decades performing everything from new-wave punk to disco-infused tunes, has died. He was 70.

The band said in a statement on its website Monday that he died from cancer, but no additional details were provided.

‚ÄúClem was not just a drummer; he was the heartbeat of Blondie,‚Äù the band said in a statement. ‚ÄúHis talent, energy, and passion for music were unmatched, and his contributions to our sound and success are immeasurable.‚Äù

The self-proclaimed ‚Äúrock & roll survivalist‚Äù started playing the drums when he was 14 in his school orchestra but was kicked out for playing too loud, according to Blondie‚Äôs website. In the 1970s, he answered a band’s ad in the Village Voice seeking a ‚Äúfreak energy‚Äù rock drummer, kicking off his decades-long career with lead singer Debbie Harry and the rest of his Blondie bandmates.

The band recorded its first album in 1976 and by the following year was touring with such icons as Iggy Pop and David Bowie. It became known as the most commercially successful band to emerge from a fertile New York rock scene that also produced Talking Heads and the Ramones.

In 2006, Burke and the other original members of Blondie were inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame after selling more than 42 million records, according to Blondie’s website.

During the late 1970s and early ‚Äô80s, the band had eight Top 40 hits, including four No. 1s: ‚ÄúHeart of Glass,‚Äù ‚ÄúCall Me,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Tide Is High‚Äù and ‚ÄúRapture,‚Äù which is regarded as the first No. 1 hit to feature rap. There‚Äôs also a five-track 1975 album demo that includes ‚ÄúPlatinum Blonde,‚Äù a sort of band mission statement. But Burke‚Äôs mark was especially solidified with his rapid, powerful drumming at the start of ‚ÄúDreaming‚Äù in 1979.

In 2022, after unearthing a New Wave treasure trove of reel-to-reel tapes, cassettes and records, the band created the box set ‚ÄúBlondie: Against the Odds, 1974-1982,‚Äù with 124 tracks and 36 previously unissued recordings, demos, outtakes and remixed versions of Blondie‚Äôs initial six studio albums.

Burke reflected on the discovery in an Associated Press article: ‚ÄúWe never would have thought that we would still be here today. Looking back at our archives, it‚Äôs pretty amazing.‚Äù

The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame described Burke in a post Monday on the social platform X as ‚Äúa versatile and distinctive drummer who played exactly what each song required ‚Äì and, when called for, let loose with blistering punk rock energy.‚Äù

item.title: Ben & Jerry's celebrating Free Cone Day: Here's how to get free ice cream
item.dc:creator: NBC Staff
NBC Staff

media:content.media:title: Ben & Jerry's Accuses Parent Company Unilever Of Dismissing CEO Over Political Speech Policies
media:content.media:description: Customers place an order at a Ben & Jerry‚Äôs ice cream shop on March 19, 2025, in San Francisco

item.excerpt: Get the scoop on how to score free ice cream from Ben & Jerry's on Tuesday, April 8.
item.description:
Ben & Jerry’s is giving ice cream lovers something to savor on Tuesday.

The company is celebrating its Free Cone Day April 8, and people can get in on the fun with free ice cream.

Where and when can you get your free cone? Here’s the scoop:

When is Free Cone Day?

Ben & Jerry’s is celebrating Free Cone Day on Tuesday, April 8.

Dairy Queen also partakes in Free Cone Day, but celebrated its version March 20.

When to get free ice cream at Ben & Jerry’s on Free Cone Day

Customers can get their free ice cream between noon and 8 p.m. at their local Ben & Jerry’s.

Where to get free ice cream at Ben & Jerry’s

You can find your nearest Ben & Jerry’s ice cream shop here.

Can you get unlimited ice cream on Free Cone Day?

Ben & Jerry’s encourages fans to get back in line as many times as they’d like on Free Cone Day.

When did Free Cone Day start?

Ben & Jerry’s celebrated Free Cone Day for the first time in 1979 to thank everyone “for all the love and support they showed us that first year of business in a renovated gas station in Burlington, Vermont,” according to the company.

item.title: What Bowen Yang, Kenan Thompson said about Morgan Wallen's abrupt ‚ÄòSNL' exit
item.dc:creator: Liz Calvario | TODAY
Liz Calvario | TODAY

media:content.media:title: Saturday Night Live ‚Äì Season 50
media:content.media:description: Musical guest Morgan Wallen and host Mikey Madison during Goodnights & Credits Saturday, March 29, 2025.

item.excerpt: Morgan Wallen sparked strong reactions online last month when he¬†abruptly walked off the ‚ÄúSaturday Night Live‚Äù stage¬†at the end of an episode in which he served as musical guest.
item.description:
Morgan Wallen sparked strong reactions online last month when he abruptly walked off the ‚ÄúSaturday Night Live‚Äù stage at the end of an episode in which he served as musical guest.

However, according to Bowen Yang, the country singer‚Äôs viral exit was hardly a watercooler topic the next day among the ‚ÄúSNL‚Äù cast. 

‚ÄúThis is the God‚Äôs honest truth: Nothing happened, and so even after it happened, we all just showed up to work the next day because it‚Äôs like, you‚Äôve just got to move on to the next thing,‚Äù the ‚ÄúSNL‚Äù star said while co-hosting TODAY with Jenna & Friends on April 7. 

Saturday Night Live Apr 6

‚ÄòSNL' censors episode after audience lets out raucous ‚Äòsh‚Äì‚Äò during Weekend Update

Saturday Night Live Apr 6

‚ÄòSNL' pokes fun at Morgan Wallen's abrupt exit as Jack Black and Elton John return to show

During the March 29 episode of ‚ÄúSNL,‚Äù Wallen walked offstage abruptly as the credits rolled, instead of following tradition and mingling with the cast members.

Kenan Thompson, who appeared as a guest on TODAY with Jenna & Friends, also weighed in on the viral moment.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not familiar,‚Äù Thompson joked when Jenna Bush Hager asked him about Wallen’s exit.

Thank you, Mikey Madison and @MorganWallen! Goodnight! pic.twitter.com/FDlInhhHqb

— Saturday Night Live – SNL (@nbcsnl) March 30, 2025

Thompson agreed with Yang that it was time to leave the moment in the past.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got to move on, you know what I mean?‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd I wish we would give more props to (host) Mikey (Madison) because she had a great show, and I think we would like to echo that a little more.‚Äù

Madison, who recently won an Oscar for her starring role in ‚ÄúAnora,‚Äù made her ‚ÄúSNL‚Äù hosting debut the night Wallen appeared as the musical guest.

Thompson also shared his thoughts on Wallen‚Äôs abrupt exit in a recent interview with Entertainment Weekly. 

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what goes through people‚Äôs minds when they decide to do stuff like that. I don‚Äôt know if he understood the assignment or not, or if he was really feeling a certain kind of way,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúYou see somebody before you get a chance to say hi or say good job or anything like that, they just dipping,‚Äù he also said. ‚ÄúI thought maybe he had to go to the potty or something.‚Äù

He added that Wallen‚Äôs unexpected departure was ‚Äúa spike in the norm.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre so used to everybody just turning around and high-fiving us, everybody‚Äôs saying, ‚ÄòGood job, good job, good job.‚Äô So when there‚Äôs a departure from that, it‚Äôs like, hmm, I wonder what that‚Äôs about?‚Äù

‚ÄúSNL‚Äù poked fun at Wallen‚Äôs quick exit during this weekend’s episode.

During the ‚ÄúWeekend Update‚Äù segment on April 5, co-host Colin Jost dropped a reference to Wallen while discussing the recent upheaval in the stock market.

‚ÄúJust in the past two days, investors have lost over $6 trillion,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMoney is leaving the stock market faster than Morgan Wallen at goodnights.‚Äù

Wallen‚Äôs appearance on ‚ÄúSNL‚Äù came after another controversy involving the country star and the show several years ago.

He had been scheduled to appear as the musical guest in October 2020, but was pulled from the show‚Äôs lineup after videos surfaced of him partying without a mask during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Wallen was later rebooked on the show and appeared as the musical guest that December.

  • A sloth unexpectedly gave birth in front of zoo visitors: See her baby

item.title: ‚ÄòMinecraft' mayhem over ‚Äòchicken jockey' trend leads movie theater to ban unaccompanied kids
item.dc:creator: NBC New York Staff
NBC New York Staff
item.excerpt: A movie theater in New Jersey is not allowing unaccompanied children to see the most popular movie of the year after an ‚Äúunacceptable‚Äù incident during a recent screening related to viral TikTok videos and a "chicken jockey."
item.description:
A movie theater in a New Jersey town is restricting children from seeing the most popular movie of the year after an “unacceptable” incident during a recent screening.

The Township Theater in Bergen County’s Washington Township announced Monday that children will not be admitted to any screenings for “A Minecraft Movie” without being accompanied by an adult.

“Any minors wishing to see The Minecraft Movie MUST be accompanied by a parent or responsible adult,” the movie theater wrote on Facebook. “Unaccompanied groups of boys will not be admitted.”

Theater officials said the decision was reached after a rowdy group of unsupervised children, believed to be from nearby Waldwick, vandalized and otherwise disrupted a Sunday night showing of the Jack Black flick. Multiple other moviegoers who were there with families issued complaints about the group’s inappropriate behavior, according to the theater.

“They broke seats, they squirted lotion around, I don’t know why. They made a horrific mess,” said Dave Rose, who owns the theater with his wife, Laura. “We got a call from a mom complaining to us that her experience was very bad with her son.”

The theater also said it had obtained footage of the incident, and encouraged parents to talk to their children regarding the matter.

“Some of the kids who were at the theater that night posted on TikTok filming themselves being crazy,” said Laura Rose.

Why are kids in theaters going wild over a ‘Minecraft’ scene? Blame TikTok

So what is causing young people to act out and create disruptions amid “Minecraft” showings? It has a bit to do with TikTok and internet culture.

Much of the uproar centers around a particular scene featuring a baby zombie riding a chicken, known to Minecraft fans as a “chicken jockey.”

Videos posted on social media show audience members getting out of their seats, cheering, yelling, spilling drinks, throwing popcorn and other food around after Black’s character ‚Äî Steve, the playable character in the video game ‚Äî announces Jason Mamoa’s character will be facing off against one in what appears to be a boxing ring.

As Mamoa stands in the ring in the opposite corner of a chicken, a box appears above the cube-like bird. Falling from that box is a child zombie, which sits on the chicken and smiles before turning angry and charging at Mamoa. That’s when Black’s character simply says “chicken jockey” ‚Äî which causes the young audience members to go wild, videos show.

Video from Seaford Cinemas on Long Island, courtesy of @salesmenpod, showed what some of the crowds have looked like ‚Äî and then police coming in afterward to escort some of the moviegoers from the cinema:

@salesmenpod This whole night was surreal and one of the most unforgettable movie experiences I‚Äôve ever had. . . #minecraft #movie #minecraftmovie #chicken #jockey #chickenjockey #fyp #viral #reaction #funny #meme #moviereview #featureme #clips #comedy #video #videogames #games #game ‚ô¨ original sound – Salesmen: After Hours

Part of why the scene has blown up so much boils down to internet/meme culture, with videos of such frenzied attendees going viral on TikTok, causing more people to want to go and do the same.

item.title: Soccer star Ashlyn Harris gets candid on her past addiction
item.dc:creator: Bentley Maddox | E! Online
Bentley Maddox | E! Online

media:content.media:title: Glamour's 2024 Women of the Year ‚Äì Arrivals
media:content.media:description: File. Ashlyn Harris at Glamour‚Äôs 2024 Women of the Year held at The Times Square EDITION on October 8, 2024 in New York City.

item.excerpt: Retired soccer star Ashlyn Harris shared how she overcame her misuse of Adderall in college and why she doesn‚Äôt want the trauma of that experience to impact her and ex-wife Ali Krieger‚Äôs kids.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online.

Ashlyn Harris is making a huge play at honesty.

The retired soccer star recently opened up about her difficult past, detailing her misuse of amphetamines while battling sports injuries in college at the University of North Carolina.

‚ÄúI was getting really heavily addicted to Adderall and misusing it,‚Äù Harris said on the March 21 episode of the “Question Everything with Danielle Robay” podcast. ‚ÄúI was taking it all the time. I would go days without sleeping. It was wild. I felt like I was gonna give myself a heart attack. I was crushing it. I was snorting it. It was so problematic.‚Äù

The 39-year-old ‚Äî who confirmed her relationship with “One Tree Hill” alum Sophia Bush in April 2024 ‚Äî continued of her college soccer career, ‚ÄúThen I was like, ‚ÄòOh, it makes me skinny. It curbs my appetite.‚Äô It was just a toxic, toxic time for me because it was the first time that I started to have my character tested because I started to get injured.‚Äù

But despite her addiction struggle while recovering from her multiple ACL and labrum injuries, Harris’ college soccer coach Anson Dorrance was there to support her.

READ: Where Ashlyn Harris and Ex Ali Krieger Stand After Breakup

‚ÄúIt got really, really dark and I had to make some serious adjustments,‚Äù she explained, ‚Äúand Anson would have me read books. I started reading this book called [Man‚Äôs Search] for Meaning and it’s about suffering and reframing it and it changed my life.‚Äù

In the aftermath of her college experience, the two-time FIFA Women’s World Cup champ is now focused on using the hard-won lessons she learned to build a better future for her children, Sloane, 4, and Ocean, 2, who she shares with ex-wife Ali Krieger.

‚ÄúI have a lot of trauma in my life and I have a lot of scars. I do not want to project and place that on my children,‚Äù Harris shared. ‚ÄúWhen you become a mom and you’re molding young humans, your perspective in life changes. You have to get your s— together because they see and hear everything.‚Äù

She added, ‚ÄúI just want to give my kids the best tools to be whoever they want to be. But at the core of them, they need to be good people. They have to be good people. How they serve their community, how they show up for their friends, that matters.‚Äù

If you or someone you know is struggling with drug addiction, call the national hotline for drug abuse at 1-888-633-3239 to receive information regarding treatment and recovery.

item.title: Denis Arndt, Tony-nominated star of ‚ÄòHeisenberg' and veteran of David E. Kelley TV shows, dies at 86
item.dc:creator: Mark Kennedy | The Associated Press
Mark Kennedy | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: 71st Annual Tony Awards ‚Äì Arrivals
media:content.media:description: NEW YORK, NY ‚Äì JUNE 11: Actor Denis Arndt attends the 71st Annual Tony Awards at Radio City Music Hall on June 11, 2017 in New York City.

item.excerpt: Character actor Denis Arndt, who was cast in ‚ÄúL.A. Law‚Äù and other series and later earned a Tony nomination for his debut on Broadway, has died at 86.
item.description:
Denis Arndt, a character actor and favorite of TV writer and producer David E. Kelley, getting cast in ‚ÄúL.A. Law,‚Äù ‚ÄúPicket Fences‚Äù and ‚ÄúChicago Hope,‚Äù and later earning a Tony nomination for his Broadway debut at age 77 in a play about mismatched lovers, has died. He was 86.

Arndt died ‚Äúpeacefully in his bed‚Äù at his cabin home in Ashland, Oregon, his family announced in an obituary published March 26. It noted that he was born in 1939, the same year ‚ÄúThe Wizard of Oz‚Äù came out.

‚ÄúThat was like Dad‚Äôs life,‚Äù it said. ‚ÄúIt started out in black and white and blossomed into a life of color, brilliance, daring adventure and passion. And it was also a little bit trippy, like Oz.‚Äù

Arndt was a Vietnam veteran helicopter pilot who twice was awarded the Purple Heart and later flew helicopters in Alaska. He turned to acting after moving to Seattle, spending multiple seasons at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival and performing as an early member of the Intiman Theatre in Seattle.

His career began in the mid-1980s with roles on the TV shows ‚ÄúCrime Story‚Äù and ‚ÄúWiseguy‚Äù and he would spend the 1990s in TV and film, with a highlight being one of the cops interrogating Sharon Stone‚Äôs character in Paul Verhoeven‚Äôs ‚ÄúBasic Instinct.‚Äù

Making his first and only Broadway appearance at age 77 opposite Mary-Louise Parker, Arndt received acclaim for his performance in ‚ÄúHeisenberg,‚Äù which debuted off-Broadway in 2015 before hitting Broadway a year later.

In the play by Simon Stephens, babble-mouthed 42-year-old Georgie from New Jersey randomly meets a bored 75-year-old Irish butcher, Alex, in a London train station and the two begin a strange courtship.

The Associated Press was charmed by the performers and Stephens’ play: ‚ÄúHe captures new love and old love at the same time, hope and fear, the new world and the old. He‚Äôs turned the simplest of tales ‚Äî boy meets girl ‚Äî into an unexpectedly rich thing with just two chairs, two tables and two actors.‚Äù

On TV, Arndt was a frequent Kelly collaborator, starting with ‚ÄúL.A. Law‚Äù and then as lawyer Franklin Dell on ‚ÄúPicket Fences‚Äù over four seasons. He also had roles on ‚ÄúChicago Hope,‚Äù ‚ÄúAlly McBeal,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Practice,‚Äù ‚ÄúBoston Public,‚Äù ‚ÄúBoston Legal‚Äù and ‚ÄúMr. Mercedes.‚Äù

His other small-screen credits include ‚ÄúProvidence, ‚ÄùThe Wonder Years,” ‚ÄúMurder, She Wrote,‚Äù ‚ÄúLife Goes On,‚Äù ‚ÄúHerman‚Äôs Head,‚Äù ‚ÄúTouched by an Angel,‚Äù ‚ÄúGrey‚Äôs Anatomy‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Good Fight.‚Äù

He is survived by his wife, Magee, and his children, Scott, Tammy, Laurie, Kirsten, Bryce, McKenna and Tanner.

item.title: Long-extinct dire wolves, made famous by ‚ÄòGame of Thrones,' brought back to life
item.dc:creator: Mike Gavin and The Associated Press
Mike Gavin and The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Dire Wolves
media:content.media:description: Colossal Biosciences, a biotechnology company, announced the recent births of three dire wolves via its de-extinction process.

item.excerpt: Colossal Biosciences announced the birth of three dire wolfs, a species that was extinct for nearly 13,000 years and made famous in "Game of Thrones."
item.description:
Winter is coming … and so are the dire wolves.

The large canines ‚Äî best known for being featured in the HBO series “Game of Thrones” ‚Äî went extinct nearly 13,000 years ago. But they’re now making a comeback.

Colossal Biosciences, a Dallas-based biotech company, announced Monday it has revived the species by breeding three wolf pups that carry genes of their long-lost ancestors.

As part of a gene-editing restoration process the company calls de-extinction, the DNA from the fossils of dire wolves was extracted and used to edit the genes of gray wolves. Those edited cells were used to create embryos that were transferred to surrogates, leading to the rebirth of an extinct species.

The three pups, who were born six months ago, are named Romulus, Remus and Khaleesi. They feature traits of dire wolves — including a larger, stronger body and a longer, fuller coat with light pigmentation.

“This massive milestone is the first of many coming examples demonstrating that our end-to-end de-extinction technology stack works,‚Äù said Ben Lamm, the CEO of Colossal. ‚ÄúOur team took DNA from a 13,000-year-old tooth and a 72,000-year-old skull and made healthy dire wolf puppies.”

Don’t call it a comeback, some experts say.

University at Buffalo biologist Vincent Lynch told NBC News the results only bring back the exterior semblance of an extinct species. Additionally, Lynch stresses this latest effort doesn‚Äôt mean dire wolves are coming back to North American grasslands any time soon.

‚ÄúAll you can do now is make something look superficially like something else‚Äù‚Äî not fully revive extinct species, he said.

How was dire wolf DNA discovered?

Colossal scientists learned about specific traits that dire wolves possessed by examining ancient DNA from fossils.

Researchers studied a 13,000 year-old dire wolf tooth unearthed in Ohio and a 72,000 year-old skull fragment found in Idaho ‚Äî both part of natural history museum collections.

Beth Shapiro, Colossal‚Äôs chief scientist, says the scientists then took blood cells from a living gray wolf and used CRISPR to genetically modify them in 20 different sites.

They transferred that genetic material to an egg cell from a domestic dog, Shapiro said. When ready, embryos were transferred to surrogates, also domestic dogs, and 62 days later the genetically engineered pups were born.

Where do the dire wolf pups live?

The pups live in an undisclosed 2,000-plus acre preserve in the northern United States that Colossal says is enclosed by a “10-foot-tall, zoo-grade fencing with redundant perimeter security.” Ten full-time animal care staffers tend to the wolves’ well-being.

Colossal also announced that it birthed two litters of cloned red wolves, an endangered species, by using a new approach to non-invasive blood cloning. In March, the company revealed the birth of the woolly mouse — mice featuring mammoth-like traits engineered by gene modifications.

“It was once said, ‚Äòany sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic,‚Äô‚Äù Lamm said. ‚ÄúToday, our team gets to unveil some of the magic they are working on and its broader impact on conservation.‚Äù

Colossal is calling the dire wolf the world‚Äôs first successfully de-extincted animal. 

The wolves were first brought back to life on screen in 2011 when “Game of Thrones” was adapted from George R.R. Martin’s fantasy novel series “A Song of Ice and Fire.” 

Artificial Intelligence Mar 27

Kicked out of Columbia, this student doesn't plan to stop trolling big tech with AI

UC San Diego Mar 5

Turns out vaping ‚Äî here comes the science ‚Äî doesn't help smokers quit: UCSD study

‚ÄúMany people view dire wolves as mythical creatures that only exist in a fantasy world, but in reality, they have a rich history of contributing to the American ecosystem,‚Äù Martin said in a statement. ‚ÄúI get the luxury to write about magic, but Ben and Colossal have created magic by bringing these majestic beasts back to our world.‚Äù

item.title: Bill Murray says masked kiss led to sexual misconduct allegation that shut down movie

item.excerpt: Bill Murray said a masked kiss in 2022 on the set of a movie led to sexual misconduct allegations that eventually shut down the film, an incident the famed actor says still bothers him.
item.description:
Bill Murray said a masked kiss in 2022 on the set of a movie led to sexual misconduct allegations that eventually shut down the film, an incident the famed actor says still bothers him and feels he was ‚Äúbarbecued‚Äù for.

In 2022, a female staff member working on the film set for ‚ÄúBeing Mortal‚Äù accused the “Ghostbusters” and “Groundhog Day” star of behaving inappropriately with her. The film, directed by Aziz Ansari, was eventually shelved by Searchlight Pictures.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt go too many days or weeks without thinking of what happened in ‚ÄòBeing Mortal,‚Äô‚Äù the 74-year-old actor told The New York Times in an interview published Saturday. 

He explained that he had known the woman who made the complaint, and the incident involved him kissing her as they were both wearing face masks that were part of Covid-19 protocols.

Murray and the woman eventually reached a settlement,¬†Deadline¬†reported. The woman was never identified by anyone affiliated with the movie and has not come forward to comment on the matter.

When asked to discuss what unfolded, Murray said, “I tried to make peace. I thought I was trying to make peace. I ended up being, to my mind, barbecued.”

‚ÄúBut someone that I worked with, that I had had lunch with on various days of the week ‚Äî it was Covid, we were all wearing masks, and we were all stranded in this one room listening to this crazy scene. I dunno what prompted me to do it. It‚Äôs something that I had done to someone else before, and I thought it was funny, and every time it happened, it was funny,” Murray said.

“I was wearing a mask, and I gave her a kiss, and she was wearing a mask,” he explained. “It wasn‚Äôt like I touched her, but it was just, I gave her a kiss through a mask. And she wasn‚Äôt a stranger.”

He said the incident still ‚Äúbothers me.‚Äù

“Because that movie was stopped by the human rights or ‘H & R’ of the Disney corporation, which is probably a little bit more strident than some other countries‚Äô. It turned out there were pre-existing conditions and all this kind of stuff. I‚Äôm like, what? How was anyone supposed to know anything like that? There was no conversation, there was nothing. There was no peacemaking, nothing,” Murray said.

“It went to this lunatic arbitration, which, if anyone ever suggests you go to arbitration: Don‚Äôt do it. Never ever do it. Because you think it‚Äôs justice, and it isn‚Äôt,” he continued.

The veteran comedian and critically acclaimed actor, who has a long history of alleged bad behavior on movie sets, said he thinks the whole experience was “stupid.” 

“You can teach an old dog new tricks. But it was a great disappointment, because I thought I knew someone, and I did not. I certainly thought it was light. I thought it was funny,” he said. “To me it‚Äôs still funny, the idea that you could give someone a kiss with a mask on. It‚Äôs still stupid. It‚Äôs all it was.”

This story first appeared on NBCNews.com. More from NBC News:

item.excerpt: Where will the characters of ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù check into next?¬† After an explosive¬†Season 3 finale¬†on April 6, the show‚Äôs writer, director and creator Mike White teased where the fourth season will be set ‚Äî or at least, where it¬†won‚Äôt¬†be.¬† ‚ÄúFor the fourth season, I want to get a little bit out of the ‚Äòcrashing waves against rocks‚Äô vernacular,‚Äù he...
item.description:
Where will the characters of “The White Lotus” check into next? 

After an explosive Season 3 finale on April 6, the show’s writer, director and creator Mike White teased where the fourth season will be set ‚Äî or at least, where it won‚Äôt be. 

‚ÄúFor the fourth season, I want to get a little bit out of the ‚Äòcrashing waves against rocks‚Äô vernacular,‚Äù he said in an interview at the end of the Season 3 finale.

The first three seasons of the hit drama took place at fictional luxury seaside resorts in real locations: the first season was set in Maui, Hawaii; the second season in Sicily, Italy; and the latest season at an idyllic beach resort in Thailand.

But even if the next season of ‚ÄúWhite Lotus‚Äù unfolds somewhere more inland, it sounds like the show will continue to serve up the same wicked cocktail of privilege, sex and death.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs always room for more murders at the White Lotus hotels,‚Äù White said with a laugh.

Production for Season 4 will likely begin in 2026, Variety reported in January. 

It‚Äôs unknown whether any previous cast members will appear in the new season, as a few have done in previous seasons. Jennifer Coolidge (Tanya McQuoid), Natasha Rothwell (Belina Lindsey) and Jon Gries (Greg Hunt) have all appeared in more than one season. 

Fans can expect that the next season‚Äôs opening theme music will likely have a different feel. Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer, the composer who created the opening songs of all three seasons, recently confirmed to the New York Times that he will not be returning for another season, citing creative differences with White.

This isn’t the first time White has teased an upcoming season of ‚ÄúThe White Lotus.” When Season 2 ended, he hinted at the direction the show would take for Season 3. 

‚ÄúThe first season kind of highlighted money, and then the second season is sex, and I think the third season, it would be maybe a kind of satirical and funny look at death and Eastern religion and spirituality,‚Äù he previously shared in an interview that aired at the end of Season 2.

This story first appeared on TODAY.com. More from TODAY:

  • ‚ÄòWhite Lotus‚Äô Season 3 ending explained: Who dies and how?
  • Fans react to emotional ‚Äò1923‚Äô Season 2 finale: ‚ÄòI can‚Äôt stop crying‚Äô

item.excerpt: Tennis pioneer Billie Jean King added another first to her list of accomplishments Monday when her star was unveiled on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. King, a groundbreaking sports figure and graduate of Long Beach Poly High School, became the first woman to receive a star in the sports entertainment category. King was honored for her work as an executive producer of the 2023 Public Broadcasting Service documentary series, ‚ÄúGroundbreakers‚Äù ‚Äî which paired King and other such legendary female athletes as Basketball Hall of Famer Nancy Lieberman, two-time Women‚Äôs World Cup champion and two-time Olympic gold medalist Julie Foudy and...
item.description:
Tennis pioneer Billie Jean King added another first to her list of accomplishments Monday when her star was unveiled on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

King, a groundbreaking sports figure and graduate of Long Beach Poly High School, became the first woman to receive a star in the sports entertainment category.

King was honored for her work as an executive producer of the 2023 Public Broadcasting Service documentary series, “Groundbreakers” ‚Äî which paired King and other such legendary female athletes as Basketball Hall of Famer Nancy Lieberman, two-time Women’s World Cup champion and two-time Olympic gold medalist Julie Foudy and track and field world record holder Jackie Joyner-Kersee ‚Äî with current stars four-time tennis singles Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka, two-time Olympic gold medal-winning snowboarder Chloe Kim and two-time Olympic gymnastics gold medalist Sunisa Lee, Ana Martinez, the Hollywood Walk of Fame’s producer, told City News Service.

King’s other entertainment credits include being an executive producer of “The Battle of the Sexes,” a 2013 documentary on her 1973 match against Bobby Riggs; portraying a judge on a 2007 episode of the long-running NBC crime and legal drama, “Law & Order”; and portraying herself on episodes of such series as “Fresh Off the Boat,” “Arli$$” and a 1973 episode of “The Odd Couple” that featured Riggs.

Basketball Hall of Famer Earvin Magic Johnson, a fellow member of the Dodgers’ ownership group with King, and Oscar-winning actress Jamie Lee Curtis, a longtime friend of King’s, joined her in speaking at the ceremony at 6284 Hollywood Blvd., adjacent to the W Hotel.

“What I love about BJK is she uses her platform to bring about change,” Johnson said.

The star is the 2,807th since the completion of the Walk of Fame in 1961 with the initial 1,558 stars.

King is a pioneer in the women’s rights and gender-equality movements. In 1970, she was part of the “Original Nine” women’s professional tennis players who broke away from the governing bodies of tennis to form their own professional tour, the Virginia Slims Circuit, which later evolved into the modern Women’s Tennis Association Tour.

King was also among the founders of World Team Tennis, the first co-ed professional sports league. She is a member of the Professional Women’s Hockey League Founding Advisory Board. The league’s Most Valuable Player award is named for her.

King won 39 Grand Slam titles — 12 in singles competition, 16 in women’s doubles and 11 in mixed doubles. In 1971, King became the first woman athlete to earn $100,000 in a year.

Hollywood Feb 18

From ‚ÄòThe Office' to the Hollywood Walk of Fame: Mindy Kaling honored with star

King was inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame in 1987. In 1990, Life magazine named her one of the “100 Most Important Americans of the 20th Century.”

The category was announced in 2021 by the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce, which administers the Walk of Fame. It honors individuals, not teams or sports affiliated groups, who have made significant contributions to the world of entertainment and demonstrated “longevity of excellence” in their sport, according to Ana Martinez, the Hollywood Walk of Fame’s producer.

New York Giants Hall of Fame defensive end turned “Good Morning America” anchor Michael Strahan was the first recipient in the category in 2023. The second recipient was the late Carl Weathers, honored for a nearly 50-year acting career best remembered for his portrayal of Sylvester Stallone’s boxing nemesis-turned-friend and mentor Apollo Creed in the first four “Rocky” movies.

Weathers, also a Long Beach Poly High School grad, played linebacker for San Diego State, the Oakland Raiders and Canadian Football League’s BC Lions before his acting career.

item.title: Adam Devine reveals his pinky toe fell off during NSFW bathtub moment

item.excerpt: Adam Devine, who is still dealing with the after effects of being hit by a cement truck as a kid, detailed how his first time pleasuring himself ended in a horrific accident because of the crash.¬†
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Adam Devine had a typical adolescent experience go horribly awry.

The “Modern Family” star, who recently shared that he is still dealing with health problems after getting hit by a cement truck as an 11-year-old, detailed how his first time pleasuring himself ended with him losing a toe.

‚ÄúI’m in the bathtub and I couldn’t stand because of my accident, and I just found masturbation, and oh, did I love it,‚Äù Devine explained during an April 2 episode of “In Depth with Graham Bensinger.” ‚ÄúThis was one of the first times I had masturbated and it‚Äôs a pretty epic event when you figure it out, you‚Äôre like, ‚ÄòI can do this all the time?‚Äô”

But Devine shared that his big moment was quickly interrupted by an effect of his accident.

‚ÄúSo I‚Äôm in the bathtub and I couldn‚Äôt stand because of my accident‚ÄîI‚Äôm cranking down,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúIt was the first time something had come out. And I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòWhat is this?‚Äô And as I‚Äôm trying to get it to dissipate, I see a little toe ‚Äî my pinky toe, just floating in the bathtub.‚Äù

READ: Adam Devine Says Doctors Told Him He Was Dying Due to Childhood Accident

And while doctors told Devine, now 41, that his toe was likely to fall off due to his accident, he joked, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking I jerked off so hard my toe fell off.‚Äù

Naturally, when his mom, Penny Devine ‚Äîwho Devine explained was a huge help when it came to his recovery ‚Äî came in to help, he began shouting, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt touch the water!‚Äù

Later in the same episode, the “Workaholics” actor shared that he is still dealing with symptoms from the accident.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a nightmare,‚Äù Devine admitted. ‚ÄúI have spasms all over. For a while, [the doctors] told me I was dying‚Äîliterally, within this last year.‚Äù

Indeed, Devine’s medical team thought he may have developed Stiff Person Syndrome, but ultimately discovered his muscles are still vulnerable after his accident as a kid.

‚ÄúMy body has all these things that are a little wonky and a little wrong with it,‚Äù he shared, ‚Äúthat I just sort of snapped.‚Äù

After several rounds of stem cells, Adam is on his road to recovery‚Äîbut clearly not without a few NSFW hiccups on the way.

This story first appeared on E! Online. More from E!:

media:content.media:title: HBO's ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 Finale Event
media:content.media:description: Jon Gries, Charlotte Le Bon, Tayme Thapthimthong, Leslie Bibb, Jason Isaacs, Aimee Lou Wood, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Sam Nivola, Sarah Catherine Hook and Nicholas Duvernay pose onstage at HBO‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 Finale Event at Four Seasons Hotel Westlake Village, California on April 6, 2025, in Westlake Village, California.

item.excerpt: "The White Lotus" season 3 finale came and went Sunday with the answers to fans‚Äô biggest questions revealed ‚Äî including which unlucky guest died.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online.

Warning: This article contains major spoilers for the April 6 finale of “The White Lotus.”

Multiple guests have checked out of “The White Lotus” ‚Äî permanently.

Indeed, during the heartbreaking season 3 finale, Chelsea (Aimee Lou Wood) and Rick (Walton Goggins) were the guests whose vacation ended in tragedy.

While Rick had seemingly found peace, his happiness was disrupted when the man he thought killed his father, Jim Hollinger (Scott Glenn), returned to the White Lotus. And when Rick shoots him in a fit of rage ‚Äî only for Sritila (Lek Patravadi) to tell him Jim was Rick’s father all along ‚Äî Rick and Chelsea are both killed in the subsequent shootout.

It was a heartbreaking, yet epic, 90-minute conclusion the season that maybe shouldn‚Äôt have come as a surprise. After all, actress Charlotte Le Bon (who played Chloe) warned The Hollywood Reporter ahead of the finale, ‚ÄúPeople are going to hate Mike White.‚Äù

And indeed, the creator and writer knew his finale may bring about mixed reactions.

‚ÄúMy hope is that it‚Äôll feel like a cathartic sad or a satisfying sad and not a ‚ÄòWhat the f—?‚Äô sad,‚Äù he added to THR in the interview published April 2. ‚ÄúBut people are going to have a million different opinions. You just hope you stick the landing.‚Äù

READ: The White Lotus Cast‚Äôs Surprising Salaries Revealed

news Apr 6

How ‚ÄòWhite Lotus' fans can get the best Thailand travel deals: ‚ÄòPrice alerts are going to be more important than ever,' one expert says

Streaming series Apr 3

‚ÄòWhite Lotus' composer quits over feud with Mike White

Television Mar 27

Duke University says ‚ÄòThe White Lotus' went ‚Äòtoo far' with using its apparel

For the “Survivor” alum, even bringing to life the feature-length finale episode was a labor of love.

‚ÄúAs a filmmaker,‚Äù he added, ‚Äúit‚Äôs probably the piece of work that I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòI can‚Äôt believe I did that.‚Äô‚Äù

But while fans were on the edge of their seats heading into the April 6 finale to see how everything unfolded, as it turns out, some of the cast was, too.

Parker Posey, who played Victoria Ratliff, confessed to THR, ‚ÄúI forgot who died. It was so stressful when I read it. The dark stuff, I blazed through.‚Äù

Plus, some cast and crew members were specifically left in the dark as to prevent spoilers ‚Äî including Patrick Schwarzenegger, whose portrayal of Saxon Ratliff caused quite a stir throughout the season.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just excited to watch the finale with the rest of the world,‚Äù he admitted, ‚Äúbecause I actually have no idea what happens.‚Äù

As producer David Bernad explained, ‚ÄúThis season, our script supervisor wrote these crazy fake endings that we distributed on set. We didn‚Äôt distribute the real last script. People on set didn‚Äôt know.‚Äù

Which means, some cast and crew also didn‚Äôt know about the fates of other beloved characters, whose fates were wrapped up in the finale.

For the Ratliff family, tragedy almost strikes when Lochlan unwittingly serves himself a poisoned smoothie, however, he revives in his father’s arms, and the Southern family returns home ‚Äî their lives about to be forever changed due to Timothy’s misdeeds.

The three friends ‚Äî Laurie, Jaclyn and Kate ‚Äî ultimately forgive each other’s jabs and leave the White Lotus closer than before, while Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) leaves $5 million richer after she strikes a deal with Gary/Greg (Jon Gries) to keep silent over the mysterious circumstances of his wife’s death.

But no matter how fans feel about saying goodbye to Rick and Chelsea, no one feels more bittersweet about their check out from the White Lotus than White.

‚ÄúTo be honest, I‚Äôm a bit of a head case right now,‚Äù the “School of Rock” alum admitted, telling THR he was crying in his car thinking about it. ‚ÄúThis show is my whole life, then it‚Äôs over and I‚Äôm back in my house with my dog, trying to remember who my friends are and what did I do before the show.‚Äù

item.title: Jay North, TV's mischievous Dennis the Menace, dies at 73
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Obit Jay North
media:content.media:description: FILE ‚Äì Jay North, young star of the new ‚ÄúDennis the Menace‚Äù series, right, attempts to handcuff Dean Martin, center, as they play with a stuffed toy with Tony Curtis on Sept. 15, 1959.

item.excerpt: Jay North, who starred as the towheaded mischief maker on TV‚Äôs ‚ÄúDennis the Menace‚Äù for four seasons starting in 1959, has died. He was 73.
item.description:
Jay North, who starred as the towheaded mischief maker on TV’s ‚ÄúDennis the Menace‚Äù for four seasons starting in 1959, has died. He was 73.

North died Sunday at his home in Lake Butler, Florida, after battling colon cancer, said Laurie Jacobson, a longtime friend, and Bonnie Vent, who was his booking agent.

‚ÄúHe had a heart as big as a mountain, loved his friends deeply. He called us frequently and ended every conversation with ‚ÄòI love you with all my heart,‚Äô‚Äù Jacobson wrote in a tribute on Facebook.

North was 6 when he was cast as the smiling troublemaker in the CBS sitcom adaptation of Hank Ketcham’s popular comic strip that took place in an idyllic American suburb.

Often wearing a striped shirt and overalls, Dennis’ mischievous antics frequently frustrated his retired next-door neighbor George Wilson, played by Joseph Kearns. Dennis’ patient parents were played by Herbert Anderson and Gloria Henry.

The show ran on Sunday nights until it was canceled in 1963. After that it was a fixture for decades in syndication.

Later, North appeared on TV in shows including ‚ÄúThe Man from U.N.C.L.E.,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Lucy Show,‚Äù ‚ÄúMy Three Sons,‚Äù ‚ÄúLassie‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Simpsons,‚Äù and in movies like ‚ÄúMaya‚Äù (1966), ‚ÄúThe Teacher‚Äù (1974) and ‚ÄúDickie Robert: Former Child Star‚Äù (2003).

North is survived by his third wife, Cindy, and three stepdaughters.

item.title: Comedian Jeff Ross shares shocking result of ice cream allergy
item.dc:creator: Corinne Heller | E! Online
Corinne Heller | E! Online
