media:content.media:description: Jeff Ross attends ‚ÄúG.R.O.A.T The Greatest Roast Of All Time: Tom Brady‚Äù for the Netflix is a Joke Festival at The Kia Forum on May 05, 2024 in Inglewood, California.

item.excerpt: Comedian Jeff Ross, also known as The Roastmaster General, shared that he suffered his first allergic reaction after eating ice cream.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Jeff Ross is recovering after being rushed to the hospital to treat his first-ever allergic reaction.

The comedian, also known as the Roastmaster General, shared his negative experience with an ice cream treat on social media, along with a photo of the aftermath ‚Äî a swollen lip.

“ROAST ME. TONIGHT’S SHOW NEAR SAN FRANCISCO MUST GO ON!” the 59-year-old wrote on his Instagram April 6. “Had such a fun opening night performance of @takeabananafortheride up here in Mill Valley, California @throckmortontheatre. Afterwards, me and the band celebrated with some Burata ice cream at a restaurant down the street courtesy of the nice owner.”

Ross ‚Äî who performed on many of Comedy Central’s celebrity roasts and on Netflix’s 2024 “The Roast of Tom Brady” ‚Äî continued, “It was delicious. Seriously yummy. But my lips blew up and I spent the entire night in the ER. It was my first allergic reaction ever. I guess that‚Äôs pretty remarkable considering I‚Äôm constantly shoving whatever food is in front of me into my face.”

READ Watch John Mayer and Jeff Ross’ Touching Tribute to Bob Saget After Picking Up His Car at LAX

The comic thanked those working the overnight shift at MarinHealth Medical Center for “only roasting” him “lightly,” adding, “DESPITE LOOKING LIKE MICKEY ROURKE at the end of The Wrestler‚Ä¶ I WILL BE TAKING A NAP AND BACK ON STAGE HERE IN MILL VALLEY NEAR SAN FRANCISCO AT 730pm TONIGHT.”

Ross, who is performing his new one-man show Take a Banana for the Ride, had his photo reposted on the Throckmorton Theatre’s Instagram Stories, along with the quip, “Don’t mind how @therealjeffreyross looks, it’s worse than it is.”

Ross’ reaction to the ice cream comes follows a different health crisis. Last year, the comedian revealed at his comedy shows he had been diagnosed with cancer. He said his treatment has been successful, but declined to elaborate, the Minnesota Star Tribune reported this past March.

“I don’t want the show to be maudlin, but I think it‚Äôs important to address it,” he told the newspaper about talking about his diagnosis on stage. “I don‚Äôt want people to feel sorry for me. It‚Äôs going to be a very empowering and bold statement on how to get through tough times.”

On the Netflix special “Torching 2024: A Roast of the Year,” which Ross hosted, his friend John Stamos noted the comedian was in recovery and remission.

“I can’t lose anymore funny people,” the Full House alum ‚Äî whose costar Bob Saget, a mutual friend, died in 2022 ‚Äî said to Ross, after kissing him on the cheek. “The world can’t.”

item.title: First-ever ‚ÄòThe Breakfast Club' reunion with all 5 members happening in Chicago
item.dc:creator: NBC Chicago Staff
NBC Chicago Staff

media:content.media:title: tlmd_sexo_matrimonio_24
media:content.media:description: Considered one of the greatest cult teen films of all time, The Breakfast Club is the story of a group of teenagers from different cliques trapped together in Saturday detention. The film was directed and written by John Hughes, and shot entirely in sequence.

item.excerpt: They didn't forget about us either, Chicago. For the first time ever, the five core cast members of the popular 1985 John Hughes movie "The Breakfast Club" are set to reunite in Chicago- and the day is almost here.
item.description:
They didn’t forget about us either, Chicago.

For the first time ever, the five core cast members of the popular 1985 John Hughes movie “The Breakfast Club” are set to reunite in Chicago — and the day is almost here.

Ally Sheedy, Anthony Michael Hall, Emilio Est√®vez, Judd Nelson and Molly Ringwald are all listed on the guests page of C2E2, Chicago Comic & Entertainment Expo, beginning Friday and running through Sunday at McCormick Place.

“First time for everything,” Est√®vez wrote on Instagram this week. “A reunion 40 years in the making. See you soon, Chicago.”

C2E2 says this will be “the first and only time ever” the full main cast will reunite in Chicago.

“Welcome to C2E2, Emilio Est√®vez!” the convention wrote on Instagram. “For the first and only time ever, the full main cast of The Breakfast Club is reuniting in Chicago this April to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the film. Emilio (all days) joins Molly Ringwald, Ally Sheedy (Sat-Sun), Anthony Michael Hall and Judd Nelson (now all days!). Don‚Äôt miss this exciting and rare opportunity.”

“The Breakfast Club” celebrated its 40th anniversary this year, in February.

Sheedy, Hall, Nelson and Ringwald, who play Allison Reynolds, Brian Johnson, John Bender and Claire Standish, respectively, in “The Breakfast Club” have made appearances together at comic-con and fan expos in the past. The inclusion of Est√®vez, who played Andrew Clark, makes the occasion a rare and exciting reunion of the full crew.

Movies Dec 25, 2024

The biggest ‚ÄòHome Alone' mystery has finally been solved

And what better place than Chicago? “The Breakfast Club” was filmed in the Chicago suburb of Des Plaines at the former Maine North High School, which also made a cameo in Hughes’ “Ferris Bueller’s Day Off.”

“A brain, a beauty, a jock, a rebel and a recluse,” C2E2 wrote on Instagram. “Before the day was over, they broke the rules. Meet the full cast for exclusive Autographs and Photo Ops, backdropped with the iconic red lockers, on sale now.”

C2E2’s website shows a schedule of autographing sessions for Sheedy, Hall, Nelson and Ringwald, with autographs ranging from $60-$70 and photo ops from $80-$90. A similar schedule for Est√®vez isn’t listed, but his inclusion on the guests page notes he’ll be there all three days in the “autographing area.”

A look at the autographing sessions shows Hall will also be in attendance all weekend, while Sheedy, Nelson and Ringwald are expected to be at McCormick Place Saturday and Sunday.

According to the posted schedules four of them will sign autographs beginning at 12:40 p.m. CT until about 2:30 p.m. CT on Saturday and again at about 4:40 p.m. CT that day. Their schedules align again on Sunday, with sessions beginning around 12:30 p.m. CT and 2:50 p.m. CT.

item.title: FKA Twigs drops out of Coachella over ongoing visa issues
item.dc:creator: Doha Madani | NBC News
Doha Madani | NBC News

media:content.media:title: 250406-FKA-Twigs-vl-343p-fe2698
media:content.media:description: FKA Twigs at the 2024 Met Gala in New York City on May 6.

item.excerpt: The singer said she was going to have to reschedule all of her North American commitments for April after her production team failed to file the paperwork in time.
item.description:
British singer FKA Twigs canceled her appearance at Coachella in California later this week as the performer continues to face visa issues for her North American tour. 

FKA Twigs, whose legal name is Tahliah Barnett, said Sunday that she was devastated to tell fans she’d be pulling out of the famed music festival. She was set to perform on Friday, the night Lady Gaga will be headlining the main stage. 

“It pains me to say this because i am so excited to bring you a creation that i have poured my soul into and i believe is amongst my strongest work and i know this news impacts so many of you that have already made plans and spent money in order to see these shows,” she said on her social media. 

The singer said she was going to have to reschedule all of her North American commitments for April. This would have also included a performance at Axe Ceremonia festival in Mexico City, but the festival‚Äôs Sunday date was canceled.

The update comes after FKA Twigs had to cancel last week’s performances in Chicago, New York, and Toronto. She said at the time she was informed her production team “did not fill out the correct paperwork in a timely manner for us to have our visas to come to the USA and perform.”

She’s traveling across the United Kingdom and Europe for her latest album, “Eusexua,” which was released in January. 

In her post Sunday, FKA Twigs described this tour as being amongst her strongest work. 

“I promise that i am working to reschedule the affected dates as quickly as possible,” she wrote. “for headline shows, please refer to your point of purchase for details and refund information.”

item.title: Hollywood lands a much-needed box office hit with ‚ÄòA Minecraft Movie'
item.dc:creator: Lindsey Bahr | The Associated Press
Lindsey Bahr | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Hollywood Exteriors And Landmarks ‚Äì 2025
media:content.media:description: General view of the ‚ÄòMinecraft‚Äô skyscraper billboard campaign at Hollywood & Highland on April 04, 2025 in Hollywood, California.

item.excerpt: Going into the weekend, analysts projected ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù might hit $80 million. Instead, it nearly doubled that figure.
item.description:
Hollywood needed ‚ÄúA Minecraft Movie‚Äù to be a hit, and it delivered in its opening weekend, significantly narrowing this year’s box office deficit.

No one guessed just how big it would be. In its first few days in theaters, the movie earned a staggering $157 million in ticket sales from theaters in the U.S. and Canada, according to studio estimates Sunday. Internationally, it‚Äôs looking at an additional $144 million for a global debut of $301 million. And with school spring breaks ongoing, ‚ÄúA Minecraft Movie‚Äù is just getting started.

Not only is it the biggest opening of 2025, ‚ÄúA Minecraft Movie‚Äù also broke the record for a video game adaptation, a distinction previously held by ‚ÄúThe Super Mario Bros. Movie” ($146 million). Going into the weekend, analysts projected ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù might hit $80 million. Instead, it nearly doubled that figure.

Nothing is guaranteed in the movie business, but an offering based on the best-selling video game of all time makes for a good start. It hardly mattered that the block-based game doesn‚Äôt exactly have a narrative. Many of its 200 million active monthly players turned out in droves anyway.

McDonald‚Äôs Apr 1

McDonald's Minecraft Movie meals have arrived. Here's what they come with

Movies Mar 31

Jason Momoa tells Craig he's returning for 3rd ‚ÄòDune' movie: ‚ÄòYou got me in trouble!'

Movies Mar 26

‚ÄòRust' movie trailer released 4 years after cinematographer's on-set death

The PG-rated movie, directed by Jared Hess (‚ÄúNapoleon Dynamite‚Äù), was a co-production of Legendary Entertainment and Warner Bros. It cost a reported $150 million to make, not including marketing and promotion expenses. Jack Black and Jason Momoa lead the ensemble cast (Danielle Brooks, Emma Myers and Sebastian Eugene Hansen). Their characters are transported into an imaginative dimension called the Overworld and need to go on a dangerous, and immensely silly, adventure to get home.

Critics were largely mixed on ‚ÄúA Minecraft Movie,‚Äù but audiences gave it a more promising B+ CinemaScore and 4/5 stars in PostTrak exit polls. Men made up around 62% of the audience, and 64% were under the age of 25. Warner Bros. went big on its release, opening the film in 4,263 locations domestically and 36,000 screens internationally.

‚ÄúYounger audiences love going to the movie theater, believe it or not,‚Äù said Paul Dergarabedian, the senior media analyst for Comscore. ‚ÄúWe thought this was an audience who would migrate to the small screens, but this is the perfect small screen to big screen alliance. It became a must-see theatrical event. Awareness was off the charts.‚Äù

Video game adaptations have had some pivotal successes in recent years, including ‚ÄúThe Super Mario Bros. Movie,‚Äù the ‚ÄúSonic‚Äù series and ‚ÄúFive Nights at Freddy‚Äôs.‚Äù

‚ÄúVideo games were once a genre that had very mixed results at the box office, but the code has finally been cracked,‚Äù Dergarabedian said.

Second place at this week’s box office went to the Jason Statham action pic ‚ÄúA Working Man,” which added $7.3 million in its second weekend. Third place was occupied by the second installment in the episodic ‚ÄúThe Chosen: Last Supper‚Äù series. Part two (made up of episodes three through five) earned $6.7 million over the weekend. The third and final batch of episodes arrive in theaters on April 11.

‚ÄúSnow White‚Äù slid to fourth place in its third weekend, bringing in $6.1 million. It’s now made over $168 million globally.

It‚Äôs been a difficult start to 2025 for Hollywood and movie theaters, with disappointments including ‚ÄúSnow White‚Äù and ‚ÄúMickey 17.‚Äù But one hit can change the tides significantly, especially with in-theater marketing pushes in full swing for the pivotal summer movie season, which kicks off the first weekend in May.

Before this weekend, the box office was running at a 13% deficit compared with last year. Now the gap is down to 5%.

item.title: ‚ÄòSNL' censors episode after audience lets out raucous ‚Äòsh‚Äì‚Äò during Weekend Update
item.dc:creator: Brian Price
Brian Price

media:content.media:title: Saturday Night Live ‚Äì Season 50
media:content.media:description: SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE ‚Äî Episode 1879 ‚Äî Pictured: (l-r) Anchor Colin Jost and anchor Michael Che during Weekend Update on Saturday, March 29, 2025 ‚Äî (Photo by: Will Heath/NBC via Getty Images)

item.excerpt: "Saturday Night Live" learned what happens when you offer up the mic to a live audience.
item.description:
“Saturday Night Live” learned what happens when you offer up the mic to a live audience.

The sketch show retroactively censored a moment from the April 5, Jack Black-hosted episode when cast member Ego Nwodim joined Weekend Update’s Michael Che and Colin Jost to riff on the White House Correspondents’ dinner.

NBC’s own Amber Ruffin was fired last week as the host of this year’s dinner after she referred to the Trump administration as “kind of a bunch of murderers” on a podcast. The WHCA president said the group would refocus the dinner and would not hire any comedian to replace Ruffin.

During the Weekend Update segment, Nwodim took the microphone to perform her own roast of the dinner. But instead of going after politicians and journalists, as is typical of the event’s host, Nowdim made jokes about the actual dinner.

“They talking about they serving me some seared Alaskan Halibut. So I said, ‘halibut’ you throw that mess in the trash,” she joked.

Near the end of her set, which devolved into a roast of men in general, Nwodim took a brief moment to turn the microphone to the Studio 8H audience.

Ego Nwodim shows us what her White House Correspondents‚Äô dinner routine would have been pic.twitter.com/uGqixG739W

— Saturday Night Live – SNL (@nbcsnl) April 6, 2025

“These men ain‚Äôt what?‚Äù she asked. And the audience answered.

In an uncensored clip from the episode, several members of the audience can be heard yelling back “s—!” and taking Nwodim, Che and Jost by surprise.

“We finna get fired for that,” Nwodim jokes, while Che and Jost double over in laughter behind her. “Lorne gonna be mad at y’all.”

The show wasn’t able to stop the word from going out on the broadcast during the live episode, but a censored version has since been circulated by the “SNL” social media pages and on the re-run episode playing on Peacock.

S— is one of what’s known as the FCC’s “seven dirty words,” which if used on broadcast television can earn a fine from the commission.

item.title: ‚ÄòSNL' pokes fun at Morgan Wallen controversy: ‚ÄòGet me to God's country, right?'
item.dc:creator: Brendan Brightman
Brendan Brightman

media:content.media:title: Saturday Night Live ‚Äì Season 50
media:content.media:description: (l-r) Musical guest Morgan Wallen and host Mikey Madison during Goodnights & Credits on Saturday, March 29, 2025.

item.excerpt: One week after singer Morgan Wallen drew controversy after walking off the "SNL" stage early during the end credits, the show did not ignore what had taken place.
item.description:
One week after singer Morgan Wallen drew controversy after walking off the “SNL” stage early during the end credits, the show did not ignore what had taken place.

During the show’s cold open, cast member James Austin Johnson, who was playing President Donald Trump as he announced his sweeping tariffs at the White House, referred to the viral controversy.

Johnson as Trump began riffing about the Herd Island and McDonald Islands, which are uninhabited islands the president put tariffs on in real life.

“Ooo, McDonald Island, I’d love to visit there,” Johnson as Trump said. “Can you imagine that? A Big Mac in a hula skirt. Ooo la la.”

Johnson as Trump then held up artwork depicting the scenario and then said, “get me to God’s country, right?” The comment alluded to Wallen’s Instagram post hours after his time on the show last week, where he wrote the same words along with a picture of him on an airport tarmac.

The comment was trolled by many New Yorkers, with even the Empire State Building responding to the controversy.

get me to god's country pic.twitter.com/CavpiuXfGE

— Empire State Building (@EmpireStateBldg) March 31, 2025

Wallen was also the butt of another joke during the show’s “Weekend Update,” when co-host Colin Jost compared the “Lies Lies Lies” singer to money leaving the stock market.

“Just in the past two days, investors have lost more than $6 trillion,” Jost said of the stock market slide this week. “Money is leaving the stock market faster than Morgan Wallen at good nights.”

Cast member Kenan Thompson had responded to Wallen’s actions earlier in the week in an interview with Entertainment Weekly March 31, saying, ‚ÄúI thought maybe he had to go to the potty or something.”

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs definitely a spike in the norm. We‚Äôre so used to everybody just turning around and high-fiving us, everybody‚Äôs saying, ‚ÄòGood job, good job, good job,'” Thompson added. So when there‚Äôs a departure from that, it‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòHmm, I wonder what that‚Äôs about?‚Äô‚Äù

For his part, Wallen did not respond to the controversy directly but did begin selling merchandise with the phrase ‚ÄúGet me to God‚Äôs country” on his official website.

The host for the April 5 episode of “Saturday Night Live” was Jack Black, along with musical guests Brandi Carlile and Elton John.

The “School of Rock” star broke out in song during his monologue, doing his own rendition of Aerosmith’s “Back in the Saddle.” Take a look:

item.excerpt: A rough week on Wall Street did not go unnoticed across town at 30 Rock on "Saturday Night Live" this weekend, with the show giving an "encore presentation" of President Donald Trump's announcement of sweeping tariffs this past week.
item.description:
A rough week on Wall Street did not go unnoticed across town at 30 Rock on “Saturday Night Live” this weekend, with the show giving an “encore presentation” of President Donald Trump‘s announcement of sweeping tariffs this past week.

“You know, some people say my plan is nonsense, but we’re using a formula,” James Austin Johnson as Trump said as he held up the same chart the real Trump did in his announcement.

After explaining his formula, which included a reference to the Chinese President Xi Jinping and the symbol for “sideways boobs,” Johnson as Trump assured people of their concerns.

“Anyway, your money is gone and we’re going to figure it out,” he said.

item.excerpt: Former President Barack Obama shared rare insight into life with wife Michelle Obama and how their relationship has changed after he left the White House.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Barack Obama is sharing rare insight into his marriage with Michelle Obama.

The former U.S. president says he has been spending more time doing fun things with his wife after his two back-to-back terms in the White House, which ended in 2017.

“I was in a deep deficit with my wife,” the Democratic leader told Hamilton College President Steven Tepper at an April 3 event that was part of the school’s Sacerdote Series, “so I have been trying to dig myself out of that hole by doing occasionally fun things.”

The former president went on to talk about his life at home with Michelle Obama and their children, Malia Obama, 26, and Sasha Obama, 23, while discussing times he has not been able to communicate as effectively as he wanted to.

“First of all, I constantly lose arguments to my wife, my daughters,” he said. “They mock me and ridicule me at the dinner table.”

Barack Obama Apr 5

Obama expresses deep concern as Trump admin takes aim at students and law firms

Cherry Blossoms Apr 1

Obama photobombs family snapping pics with DC's cherry blossoms on Tidal Basin

READ Barack Obama Reacts to Photobombing a Family’s Photo Shoot With Kids

The former First Lady had herself shared a few insights into the couple’s life last month. She noted a pet peeve she has about her husband of 32 years ‚Äî his time management.

“I got this husband who’s like, when it’s time to leave, it’s three o’clock, he’s getting up and going to the bathroom!” she told her brother Craig Robinson on the first episode of their “IMO” podcast, released March 11. “And I was like, ‘Dude, dude, three o’clock departure means you’ve done all that,’ you know? Don’t start looking for your glasses, you know, at the three o’clock departure.”

Michelle Obama also shared a cheeky tidbit about her love of bedtime.

“Bedtime is the best time of day,” the former First Lady said on the March 20 episode of Kylie Kelce‘s “Not Gonna Lie” podcast. “My husband teases me about how early I can go to bed.”

She added, “He just doesn’t understand. The idea of getting into some good sheets, and it’s cool.”

When asked her ideal bedtime, Michelle Obama noted, “Any time after dinner.”

She also told Kelce, who was pregnant with her and husband Jason Kelce‘s fourth daughter at the time, that the former president had once floated the idea of having another baby.

“I was like, ‘I think I’ve been lucky with these two,'” Michelle Obama said. “Barack was like, ‚ÄòWe should have a third,’ and I was like, ‚ÄòDude.'”

Look back at the Obama’ sweetest moments..

item.title: Tom Hanks' daughter E.A. says her childhood was filled with ‚Äòviolence'
item.dc:creator: Corinne Heller | E! Online
Corinne Heller | E! Online

media:content.media:title: 2024 AFI Fest ‚Äì World Premiere Screening Of ‚ÄúHERE‚Äù
media:content.media:description: FILE ‚Äì Tom Hanks attends the world premiere screening of ‚ÄúHere‚Äù during the 2024 AFI Festival at TCL Chinese Theatre on October 25, 2024 in Hollywood, California.

item.excerpt: Tom Hanks and late ex-wife Susan Dillingham's daughter E.A. Hanks alleged she suffered emotional and physical violence from her mother in her new memoir The 10.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Tom Hanks‘ only daughter is sharing rare insight into her childhood.

E.A. Hanks (short for Elizabeth Anne Hanks) accused her late mother ‚Äî the Oscar winner’s ex-wife Susan Dillingham, who went by the stage name Samantha Lewes ‚Äî of abuse following the couple‚Äôs divorce in the ‚Äò80s.

According to the 42-year-old, the mistreatment allegedly started after Dillingham obtained primary custody of her and brother Colin Hanks, now 47, and abruptly moved them from Los Angeles to Sacramento, Calif. She said the relocation caught Tom Hanks by surprise.

‚ÄúMy dad came to pick us up from school and we’re not there,” E.A. Hanks wrote in an excerpt from her book “The 10: A Memoir of Family and the Open Road,” published by People. “And it turns out we haven’t been there for two weeks and he has to track us down.”

‚ÄúEventually a divorce agreement was settled, and I would visit my dad and stepmother (and soon enough my younger half brothers) on the weekends and during summers,‚Äù she continued, referring to Tom Hank’s wife Rita Wilson and their sons Chet Hanks, 34, and Truman Hanks, 29, “but from 5 to 14, years filled with confusion, violence, deprivation, and love, I was a Sacramento girl.”

READ Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson’s Rare Night Out With Sons Truman and Chet Is Sweet Like a Box of Chocolates

And what began as a ‚Äúwhite house with columns, a backyard with a pool, and a bedroom with pictures of horses plastered on every wall‚Äù eventually turned to a home that ‚Äústank of smoke,‚Äù according to E.A.

“As the years went on, the backyard became so full of dog s–t that you couldn‚Äôt walk around it,” she recalled. “The fridge was bare or full of expired food more often than not, and my mother spent more and more time in her big four-poster bed, poring over the Bible. One night, her emotional violence became physical violence.”

E.A. Hanks said she lived with her mom until the middle of seventh grade, when her custody arrangement reversed and allowed her to move to Los Angeles while visiting Sacramento over weekends and summers. During her senior year of high school, E.A. Hanks wrote that Dillingham had called her to say she was dying.

Dillingham died at age 49 in 2002 after battling bone cancer.

Tom Hanks has rarely spoken about his divorce. In a 2020 interview, he described it as a “horribly painful time” and talked about the breakup’s impact on himself, E.A. and Colin Hanks.

“I couldn’t be a worse father and I couldn’t be a worse human being,” the “Saving Private Ryan” star said on “In Depth with Graham Bensinger.” “I think the job as a parent, one of the things I’ve learned, is to try to guarantee a carefree life for your children for as long as possible. They should not be burdened with the cares of the world until they can handle them.”

E! News has reached out to Tom Hanks’ rep and has not received comment about E.A. Hanks’ memoir.

item.title: Sean ‚ÄòDiddy' Combs hit with new sex trafficking charges a month before trial
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Sisak | The Associated Press
Michael R. Sisak | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: Sean Combs
media:content.media:description: FILE ‚Äì Sean Combs arrives at the Pre-Grammy Gala And Salute To Industry Icons at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on Saturday, Jan. 25, 2020, in Beverly Hills, Calif.

item.excerpt: Federal prosecutors on Friday added to Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs' indictment and said they expect four accusers to testify against him.
item.description:
Federal prosecutors on Friday added two charges to Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‘ indictment and said they expect four accusers to testify against him, expanding on allegations that the jailed hip-hop mogul engaged in sex trafficking with multiple women and as recently as last year.

A superseding indictment accuses Combs of using force, fraud, or coercion to compel a woman to engage in commercial sex acts from at least 2021 to 2024.

The indictment, returned by a federal grand jury in Manhattan, also alleges Combs was involved in transporting the woman ‚Äî identified only as ‚ÄúVictim-2‚Äù ‚Äî and other people, including commercial sex workers, to engage in prostitution during the same time frame.

The new charges are in addition to racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking charges filed against Combs when he was arrested in September. They increase the total number of charges against him from three to five.

In a court filing, federal prosecutors said the racketeering conspiracy charge involves allegations that Combs sex trafficked three victims and forced a fourth, one of his employees, into sexual activity with him.

In the filing, which was heavily redacted, prosecutors said three of the four accusers who are expected to testify have asked that their identities not be revealed to the press or the public and that they instead be referred to by at trial using only pseudonyms.

The accuser referred to as “Victim-1” in Combs’ charging documents is prepared to testify under her own name, prosecutors said.

Sean "Diddy" Combs Mar 20

Sean ‚ÄòDiddy' Combs shocks with gray hair and beard in court

Music & Musicians Feb 21

Sean ‚ÄòDiddy' Combs' lawyer steps down ahead of sex trafficking case

Celebrity News Mar 3

Jay-Z files a defamation lawsuit against the ‚ÄòJane Doe' who accused him of rape

Combs, 55, is scheduled to stand trial May 5. He remains locked up at a federal jail in Brooklyn. A message seeking comment on the new charges was left with his representatives.

Friday‚Äôs superseding indictment is the third filed against Combs.

In the first, filed in January, federal prosecutors disclosed that their case involved at least three women whom they said Combs forced to engage in commercial sex acts. They also alleged Combs showed a firearm to a female victim during a kidnapping and once dangled a woman over an apartment balcony.

Combs’ January indictment didn’t include additional charges but modified some details of the existing ones, including adding four years to the alleged racketeering conspiracy. Prosecutors now say it started in 2004, not 2008 as the original indictment had alleged. A superseding indictment in March contained minimal changes.

Combs denies committing any crimes and has pleaded not guilty to the first set of charges, which allege that he coerced and abused women for years with help from a network of associates and employees while silencing victims through blackmail and violence, including kidnapping, arson and physical beatings.

His arraignment on the new charges has not been scheduled. Prosecutors asked Friday that it be held at his final pretrial conference on April 25.

Federal prosecutors allege the ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Be Missing You‚Äù singer and Bad Boy Records founder used his ‚Äúpower and prestige‚Äù as a music star to induce female victims into drugged-up, elaborately produced sexual performances with male sex workers in events dubbed ‚ÄúFreak Offs.‚Äù

Central to the case is a March 2016 video showing Combs hitting and kicking his then-girlfriend, R&B singer Cassie, in a Los Angeles hotel hallway. Prosecutors contend the assault happened during a ‚ÄúFreak Off.” Combs lawyers argue the footage was nothing more than a “glimpse into a complex but decade-long consensual relationship‚Äù between the two.

Combs’ lawyers contend the case should never have been brought and are fighting to dismiss a charge involving allegations he transported a male escort across state lines.

‚ÄúThe government has concocted a criminal case based primarily on allegations that Mr. Combs and two of his longtime girlfriends sometimes brought a third party ‚Äî a male escort ‚Äî into their sexual relationship,‚Äù Combs lawyer Alexandra A.E. Shapiro wrote in a February court filing.

‚ÄúEach of the three charges in the case are premised on the theory that this type of sexual activity is a federal crime,‚Äù Shapiro added.

item.title: Reese Witherspoon reveals first look at ‚ÄòLegally Blonde' prequel
item.dc:creator: Megan Rubenstein | E! Online
Megan Rubenstein | E! Online

media:content.media:title: Reese Witherspoon and Lexi Minetree, both as ‚ÄúElle Woods‚Äù
media:content.media:description: Reese Witherspoon, left, and Lexi Minetree, right, both as the fictional ‚ÄúElle Woods.‚Äù

item.excerpt: Reese Witherspoon shared a sneak peek of the upcoming "Legally Blonde" prequel TV series, "Elle," starring Lexi Minetree as young Elle Woods.¬†
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online.

It’s hard for Reese Witherspoon to keep the upcoming “Legally Blonde” prequel series completely under wraps.

The original Elle Woods confirmed filming is underway on the upcoming prequel series “Elle,” which will follow the titular character through high school, by sharing a sneak peek of star Lexi Minetree on set.

“Harvard was hard. High School was harder. Our new series, Elle, is now in production!” Witherspoon, who is producing the new Prime Video show, shared on her Instagram April 2. “Couldn’t be more excited to introduce you all to @leximinetree as Elle Woods.”

Back in February, Witherspoon announced that Minetree, who was found in a global casting call, would take on the leading role with a sweet video.

“Allow me to introduce you to the new Elle Woods! After watching so many incredible auditions for the new Elle prequel series on @PrimeVideo, we finally found our Elle,” she wrote in the caption. “And today, I got to break the news myself! Meet @leximinetree.”

READ: You‚Äôll Bend and Snap Over Reese Witherspoon‚Äôs “Legally Blonde” Prequel Announcement

Celebrity News Jan 31

Why Reese Witherspoon's kids avoid her movies at all costs

Celebrity News Jan 2

Luke Wilson reveals the latest on a ‚ÄòLegally Blonde' sequel

As to how Minetree reacted to the news? In her own post sharing the video of her casting announcement, she wrote, “Ok ok ok, my brain is going nuts over here I don‚Äôt even know where to BEGIN.”

“Thank you to my family, friends, and reps who believe in me and my silly lil dreams,” she wrote. “Thank you to @amazonmgmstudios, @hellosunshine and everyone involved with this project for trusting me with this iconic role.”

She finished out her message by thanking the original Elle Woods herself.

“And thank you, thank you, THANK YOU to @reesewitherspoon for handing me down Elle Woods,” Lexi gushed. “I already love her so so much, I promise she‚Äôs in good hands. P.S. thank you for showing me how amazing I am going to look in the future, soooo looking forward to that:)”

And Witherspoon isn‚Äôt just revisiting the iconic role through “Elle.” The actress will return in “Legally Blonde 3,” which is being written by pal Mindy Kaling and Dan Goor.

Kaling, who shared she and Goor turned in their most recent draft of the film, previously shared insight into some of the big questions the film would explore.

“What is Elle Woods like at 42? Does she end up becoming all the things she wanted?‚Äù the “Running Point” creator posited to Time in 2022. ‚ÄúHow does that personality manifest in a grown woman? Has she become more cynical? Her brightness and her cheerfulness really worked when she was 22, but how has life changed her perspective on things?”

PHOTOS: “The Last of Us” Season 2

item.title: Mexican officials deny Fyre Festival 2 is happening in Playa del Carmen
item.dc:creator: Drew Weisholtz | TODAY
Drew Weisholtz | TODAY

media:content.media:title: Playa del Carmen, Mexico
media:content.media:description: Playa del Carmen, Mexico.

item.excerpt: It looks like the second time may not be the charm for Fyre Festival.
item.description:
It looks like the second time may not be the charm for Fyre Festival.

The location that was said to be the site of next month‚Äôs Fyre Festival 2 may not serve as the venue, leading to questions about where the event will be held.

Fyre Festival founder Billy McFarland, who announced last September plans for a sequel for the festival, said last week at a press conference that the new event would take place in Playa del Carmen, Mexico.

In an April 3 post on X, however, city hall in Playa del Carmen said on X that it will not play host for the festival.

‚Äú… No such event with that name will take place in our city,‚Äù it wrote.

‚ÄúThere is no existence of a registry nor plans that would indicate such an event taking place in this municipality,‚Äù it added.

The comments came after McFarland spoke glowingly of the area during a recent press conference.

‚ÄúOur relationships with Playa may be new, but I know I speak for the rest of the team when I say we couldn‚Äôt ask for a better group of people,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúWe are very happy to have this festival in Mexico, in Playa del Carmen. We already have permits, so this is going to be very successful,‚Äù entrepreneur and Playa del Carmen‚Äôs Martina Beach Club founder Fernando Delgado said at the press conference.

This confusion over where Fyre Festival 2 ‚Äî which has not announced any artists who will be performing ‚Äî follows the disastrous first Fyre Festival in 2017. The location was moved four months before the start date, and while customers were initially promised a luxury experience, they were served cheese sandwiches and put up in emergency relief tents instead.

McFarland wound up serving four years in prison for¬†fraud for that event. Still, he has remained committed to putting on another Fyre Festival, with tickets ranging in price from $1,400 to more than $1 million.

‚ÄúI think Fyre 2 really isn‚Äôt about the past, and it‚Äôs not really about me. It‚Äôs about taking the vision, which is strong,‚Äù he told TODAY in an interview that aired in February.

McFarland also knows people may be taking a chance in buying a ticket.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs always a risk,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre taking a risk because I made a lot of bad decisions and messed up the first festival. Until it‚Äôs experienced, there is a risk component to it.‚Äù

This story first appeared on TODAY.com. More from TODAY:

item.title: First-grader comes home with a diamond ring from an admirer, and her mom goes into detective mode
item.dc:creator: Rachel Paula Abrahamson | TODAY
Rachel Paula Abrahamson | TODAY
item.excerpt: ‚ÄúTrevor got more game these ‚Äògrown‚Äô men out there‚Ä¶ be a Trevor.‚Äù
item.description:
A Tennessee mom has a real gem of a story.

In a now-viral TikTok video, Allie Phillips shared that when her daughter Adalie was 6, she had a boyfriend who was the same age.

‚ÄúShe loves Brandon, they‚Äôre getting married,‚Äù Phillips, 30, explained.

Then one afternoon, Adalie came home from school with a token of love, and ‚Äî plot twist! ‚Äî it wasn‚Äôt from Brandon. 

Before revealing the gift, Adalie encouraged her mom to ‚Äúsit down.‚Äù Then, she announced that another first grader ‚Äî a boy named Trevor ‚Äî had given her a ring and asked her to be his girlfriend. Adalie happily said yes, leaving Brandon in the dust.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking it‚Äôs a Ring Pop or a plastic ring from a vending machine,‚Äù Phillips tells TODAY.com. 

Nope ‚Äî it was a real diamond. And it was sized for an adult.

‚ÄúSo, of course, I was like, ‚ÄòWhere did he get that ring?‚Äô‚Äù Phillips said in the TikTok clip, to which Adalie replied, ‚ÄúOh, he says he buys them all the time.‚Äù 

At that point, alarms were going off in Phillips‚Äôs head, so she quickly typed up a post on the school‚Äôs Facebook page. She shared all the juicy details about the love triangle, including how Adalie had dumped Brandon for Trevor.

‚ÄúThe comments did not disappoint,‚Äù Phillips said with a laugh.

‚ÄúTrevor got more game these ‚Äògrown‚Äô men out there‚Ä¶ be a Trevor ya‚Äôll,‚Äù one parent wrote.

Added another, ‚ÄúBut‚Ä¶ who he buying rings ‚Äòall the time‚Äô for? Little man sounds like a player.‚Äù

Phillips also heard from Trevor‚Äôs mother. The sparkler belonged to his great-grandmother, and he had swiped it when they were visiting her in Alabama. 

‚ÄúNot only did he steal a ring, but he crossed state lines with it,‚Äù Phillips joked. 

Adalie is now in second grade, and according to Phillips, she and Brandon have worked things out.

‚ÄúAt first, Brandon was really mad and wouldn‚Äôt talk to either of them, but then a week later, she came home and told me that she and Trevor broke up and she was back together with Brandon,‚Äù Phillips tells TODAY.

Ah, young love.

This story first appeared on TODAY.com. More from TODAY:

item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: An Evening with Russell Brand at Esquire Townhouse with Dior
media:content.media:description: File photo: Russell Brand takes part in a discussion at Esquire Townhouse, Carlton House Terrace on Oct. 14, 2017 in London.

item.excerpt: British police have charged comedian Russell Brand with rape and sexual assault after an investigation sparked by complaints from several women.
item.description:
British police on Friday charged comedian Russell Brand with rape and sexual assault after an investigation sparked by complaints from several women.

London‚Äôs Metropolitan Police force said Brand, 50, faces one count of rape, one of indecent assault, one of oral rape and two of sexual assault.

The alleged offenses took place between 1999 and 2005.

In September 2023, British media outlets Channel 4 and the Sunday Times published claims by four women of being sexually assaulted or raped by Brand. The accusers have not been identified.

The comedian, author and ‚ÄúGet Him To The Greek‚Äù actor has denied the allegations, saying his relationships were ‚Äúalways consensual.‚Äù

Celebrity News Sep 23, 2023

Russell Brand speaks out on sexual assault allegations for the first time

Known for his unbridled and risqu√© stand-up routines, Brand hosted shows on radio and television, wrote memoirs charting his battles with drugs and alcohol, appeared in several Hollywood movies and was briefly married to pop star Katy Perry between 2010 and 2012.

In recent years, Brand has largely disappeared from mainstream media but has built up a large following online with videos mixing wellness and conspiracy theories. He recently said he had moved to the United States.

Police said Brand is due to appear in a London court on May 2.

item.title: See Robert Irwin like you never have before in new underwear campaign
item.dc:creator: Gina Vivinetto | TODAY
Gina Vivinetto | TODAY

media:content.media:title: steve-irwin-underwear-campaign-mc-250403-01-c129ac
media:content.media:description: Robert Irwin for Bonds.

item.excerpt: Irwin, the 21-year-old son of late "Crocodile Hunter‚Äù Steve Irwin, is the star of a new photo campaign for the Australian underwear company Bonds.
item.description:
Robert Irwin is showing off a more daring side of himself as the star of a new photo campaign for the Australian underwear brand Bonds.

Irwin, the 21-year-old son of late ‚ÄúCrocodile Hunter‚Äù Steve Irwin, posed for several images in Bonds’ cheeky new “Made for Down Under” campaign wearing nothing but his skivvies while joined by a few wild animals.

Bonds, which is currently launching in the United States, shared a video of Robert Irwin on Instagram that showed the young conservationist sitting in a lawn chair with a snake wrapped around his arm and shoulder.

As a tarantula crawls up Irwin‚Äôs leg, a crocodile stares at him from nearby in the grass.

Irwin, who inherited his father‚Äôs love of wildlife, told People he jumped at the chance to appear in the campaign.

‚ÄúI mean, I‚Äôve spent my life wrangling crocs and snakes and rescuing animals. And so to feature a little slice of that excitement in this new campaign, mate, it has been so much fun,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI mean, I‚Äôm surrounded by spiders and snakes except (this time) I‚Äôm in my undies. That‚Äôs the only difference.‚Äù

Irwin said he wanted to look his best for the photos since he’s “representing Australia.” That required ‚Äúmore sit-ups‚Äù and ‚Äúless carbs,” he said.

Irwin added that staying in shape, for him, isn’t too difficult thanks to the demands of his everyday life at his family’s Australian Zoo.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve got to stay pretty fit with all the crazy stuff I‚Äôm doing,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄòI‚Äôm saving crocodiles, I‚Äôm in and out of the Aussie bush every day and it‚Äôs hard work, so you‚Äôve got to keep pretty good upper body strength, good stamina.‚Äù

He added, ‚ÄúAt Australia Zoo, our beautiful wildlife sanctuary, it‚Äôs great, I‚Äôve got about 700 acres to just run. So I‚Äôve been doing a lot of sprints, a lot of hill sprints.‚Äù

Irwin made his modeling debut in March 2024 when he walked the runway at the Melbourne Fashion Festival.

‚ÄúNever imagined I‚Äôd be walking the runway, but here we are,‚Äù Irwin captioned a collection of photos from the event on Instagram. ‚ÄúWow, thanks for an amazing night Melbourne Fashion Festival!!‚Äù

item.title: Man with same name as alleged Scarlett Johansson stalker arrested in ‚ÄòSNL' bomb threat
item.dc:creator: Tom Winter, Jonathan Dienst and Andrew Blankstein
Tom Winter, Jonathan Dienst and Andrew Blankstein

media:content.media:title: SNL50: The Anniversary Special
media:content.media:description: NEW YORK, NEW YORK ‚Äì FEBRUARY 16: Colin Jost and Scarlett Johansson attend SNL50: The Anniversary Special on February 16, 2025 at 30 Rockefeller Center in New York City. (Photo by Taylor Hill/FilmMagic)

item.excerpt: The suspect's first, middle, last name and age match the person¬†whom Scarlett Johansson has previously accused of stalking, according to court documents.
item.description:
The NYPD has arrested a man for allegedly threatening to bomb the “Saturday Night Live” studios after he messaged the threat to a Connecticut college and an administrator at that college told police, two people briefed on the matter tell NBC News. 

Police identified the man arrested as Michael Branham, 48, who was taken into custody by the NYPD and charged after the threat was discovered on Tuesday, according to an NYPD statement.

The threat was not deemed credible, two law enforcement officials say.

Branham’s first, middle, last name and age match the person whom Scarlett Johansson has previously accused of stalking in an application for a restraining order, according to court documents filed in California. 

Court documents filed in California show that a judge denied that request for a restraining order on a technicality. 

A representative for Johansson declined to comment. 

A review of social media shows that a person with Branham’s name and information has made repeated and continuous posts about the actress, who is married to “SNL Weekend Update” host Colin Jost.

The New York Post first reported the threat. 

Branham faces one count each of making a threat of mass harm and falsely reporting an incident, according to a criminal complaint obtained Friday.

According to that complaint, a phone number registered to Branham texted the Connecticut university official on Monday afternoon: “THE NEXT TIME YOU HERE FROM ME I WILL BE ON CNN FOR EXPLODING A BOMB IN SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE AUDIENCE”.

Requests for comment from the attorney representing the man charged in New York were not immediately returned. 

Bail was set at $100,000 cash or $300,000 bond Friday and an order of protection was granted, the district attorney’s office said.

item.title: Tom Cruise opens CinemaCon speech with moment of silence for Val Kilmer
item.dc:creator: Krysta Fauria | The Associated Press
Krysta Fauria | The Associated Press

media:content.media:title: 2025 CinemaCon ‚Äì Paramount Pictures Presentation
media:content.media:description: Tom Cruise, star of the upcoming film ‚ÄúMission: Impossible ‚Äì The Final Reckoning,‚Äù leads a moment of silence for late actor Val Kilmer during the Paramount Pictures presentation at CinemaCon at Caesars Palace on Thursday, April 3, 2025, in Las Vegas.

item.excerpt: Tom Cruise¬†opened his highly anticipated CinemaCon appearance on Thursday with a moving tribute to his¬†‚ÄúTop Gun‚Äù co-star, Val Kilmer,¬†who¬†died Tuesday in Los Angeles.
item.description:
Tom Cruise opened his highly anticipated CinemaCon appearance on Thursday with a moving tribute to his ‚ÄúTop Gun‚Äù co-star, Val Kilmer, who died Tuesday in Los Angeles.

‚ÄúHe loved movies and he gave a lot to all of us with his performances and his films,‚Äù Cruise said to a room full of movie theater owners. ‚ÄúI really can‚Äôt tell you how much I admired his work, how much I thought of him as a human being, and how grateful and honored I was when he joined ‚ÄòTop Gun‚Äô and then came back for ‚ÄòTop Gun: Maverick.‚Äô‚Äù

Cruise called for a moment of silence, which stood in stark contrast to the otherwise action-packed presentation of Paramount Pictures‚Äô upcoming movies.

‚ÄúThank you, Val. I wish you well on your next journey,‚Äù he said to the silent room.

Cruise was there to hype ‚ÄúMission: Impossible ‚Äî The Final Reckoning,‚Äù the eighth installment of the franchise set to hit theaters May 23.

Celebrity News Apr 2

‚ÄòI'm going to miss you': Stars react to Val Kilmer's death

Celebrity News Apr 2

Inside Val Kilmer's 11-year struggle with throat cancer

Given that the 62-year-old is one of the rare stars who is still a near-guarantee for box office success, Cruise is an unsurprising darling of the annual convention and trade show in Las Vegas, where studios hype up cinemas and seek to convince theater owners they can lure audiences out of the house.

Cruise‚Äôs tribute to McQ

Most celebrity appearances throughout the convention comprise a few minutes onstage. But Cruise gave a thoughtful, off-the-prompter tribute to Christopher McQuarrie ‚Äî or as Cruise calls him, McQ ‚Äî who was honored as CinemaCon‚Äôs director of the year.

The speech, followed by a long list of thank-yous to colleagues and the audience, lasted nearly 20 minutes before a new trailer was introduced.

Cruise talked at length about following the filmmaker‚Äôs career after McQuarrie, at 26, won the Oscar for original screenplay for ‚ÄúThe Usual Suspects.‚Äù

‚ÄúMost people are still finding their voices at that age, but McQ had already written a film that changed the cinematic landscape,‚Äù Cruise said.

The pair first worked together on the 2008 World War II drama, ‚ÄúValkyrie,‚Äù which McQuarrie co-wrote. ‚ÄúWe met in LA in my screening room and we spent hours together talking about movies. And from that meeting, I knew that he was an artist that I was going to work with for the rest of my life. I absolutely knew that he was a creative brother who shares the same love and passion for cinema,‚Äù Cruise said.

McQuarrie began directing the ‚ÄúMission Impossible‚Äù franchise with its fifth installment, ‚ÄúRogue Nation.‚Äù Cruise recounted the challenges they‚Äôve faced with the most recent two films, including pandemic lockdowns and Hollywood strikes, and credited McQuarrie with making the films happen.

‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt do it for personal glory, not just to make a film, but truly in recognition of the responsibility that we have for others, for our industry,‚Äù Cruise said.

The upcoming film was the highlight of Paramount‚Äôs slate. To kick off the presentation, four motorcyclists flew off ramps as smoke shot from the ground, before descending from the stage and weaving around through aisles as the iconic theme song played.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been an honor and a privilege to work with you, to learn from you, and to place you in harm‚Äôs way for other people‚Äôs entertainment,‚Äù McQuarrie joked to Cruise while accepting the award.

Taking big cinematic swings

Though Paramount’s other projects aren’t expected to rival ‚ÄúMission Impossible‚Äù at the box office, the studio boasted a handful of movies clearly meant to be seen on a big screen.

The first film they teased was Edgar Wright‚Äôs upcoming ‚ÄúThe Running Man,‚Äù a dystopian game show thriller based on the Stephen King novel of the same name. To tease the first footage from the film, actors Glen Powell, who is also being honored as CinemaCon’s star of the year, Colman Domingo and Josh Brolin hyped the film alongside Wright.

‚ÄúNow, more than ever, we need movies in the movie theaters that bring people from all different backgrounds and ideologies together, for one simple reason: to be entertained,‚Äù Powell said before elaborating on the lengths to which he would go to entertain audiences. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve fallen from buildings, I‚Äôve jumped through explosions, I had my body thrashed and smashed. This is probably what I get for asking Tom Cruise advice on using a stunt double.‚Äù

The studio also showed new footage from its upcoming reboot of ‚ÄúThe Naked Gun,‚Äù which stars Liam Neeson and Pamela Anderson. Channing Tatum, another CinemaCon honoree for distinguished decade of achievement in film, also came out on stage to introduce footage for ‚ÄúRoofman,‚Äù a based-on-a-true-story crime thriller about a man who escaped prison after being convicted of several robberies.

The docket was also filled with animated franchises, like ‚ÄúSmurfs,‚Äù which stars Rihanna, and ‚ÄúThe SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants,‚Äù which hits theaters in December.

‚ÄúI actually did an episode of SpongeBob in the fifth season and I did such a good job, they asked me back 18 years later,‚Äù said Mark Hamill, who stars in the latter as The Flying Dutchman.

Paramount Pictures CEO Brian Robbins painted a rosy picture of the studio, but acknowledged the company‚Äôs merger last year with Skydance.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm incredibly proud of what we‚Äôve accomplished at Paramount Pictures in the midst of all the noise going on at our parent company,‚Äù Robbins said.

item.excerpt: How many Blockbuster video stores were still open when Alex Ovechkin scored his first NHL goal in 2005? Here's what the world looked like back then.
item.description:
Much has changed over the course of Alex Ovechkin’s career, including the record books.

The Washington Capitals star is expected to rewrite those very soon when he scores his 895th career goal to become the NHL’s all-time leading scorer by breaking the record long held by Wayne Gretzky.

That historic goal will take place nearly 20 years after Ovechkin scored the first goal of his NHL career, which came during his debut on October 5, 2005.

Let’s take a look at just how different things were back when Ovechkin scored that first goal compared to when he is on the brink of becoming the league’s all-time leading scorer.

Ovechkin’s age:

2005 – 20

2025 – 39

Ovechkin’s teammates:

2005 – Dainius Zubrus, Jeff Halpern, Brian Willsie, Jamie Heward, Olaf Kolzig

2025 – Dylan Strome, Aliaksei Protas, John Carlson, Tom Wilson, Logan Thompson

Reigning champions:

2005 – The 2004-2005 NHL season was canceled due to a lockout, but the 2003-2004 champion was the Tampa Bay Lighting; San Antonio Spurs; Boston Red Sox, New England Patriots

2025 – Florida Panthers, Los Angeles Dodgers, Boston Celtics, Philadelphia Eagles

Reigning NHL MVP: 

2005 – The 2004-2005 NHL season was canceled due to a lockout. The previous season’s Hart Memorial Trophy winner as MVP was Martin St. Louis of the Tampa Bay Lightning.

2025 –  Nathan MacKinnon of the Colorado Avalanche

U.S. President

2025 – Donald Trump

item.title: ‚ÄòThe White Lotus'¬†cast's surprising salaries revealed
item.dc:creator: Adrianne Reece | E! Online
Adrianne Reece | E! Online

media:content.media:title: Los Angeles Premiere Of HBO Original Series ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 ‚Äì Arrivals
media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA ‚Äì FEBRUARY 10: (L-R) Morgana O‚ÄôReilly, Natasha Rothwell, Julian Kostov, Carrie Coon, Mike White, Sam Nivola, Arnas Fedaraviƒçius, Charlotte Le Bon, David Bernad, Nicholas Duvernay, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Jason Isaacs, Walton Goggins, Leslie Bibb, Tayme Thapthimthong, Lisa, Aimee Lou Wood, Sarah Catherine Hook, Parker Posey, Shalini Peiris and Lek Patravadi attend the Los Angeles Premiere of HBO Original Series ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 at Paramount Theatre on February 10, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Emma McIntyre/Getty Images)

item.excerpt: White Lotus¬†producers recently shared details about the show‚Äôs current third season, including the fixed salary the cast‚Äîwhich includes Leslie Bibb, Patrick Schwarzenegger and more‚Äîtakes home.¬†¬†
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

It pays to be in the White Lotus.

The HBO series has their characters unwinding (and raising incestuous havoc) in the most stunning resorts around the world. That shared comfort carries over to the actors‚Äô real-life salaries, where one of the show‚Äôs producers David Bernard revealed the cast‚Äîwhich currently includes Parker Posey, Carrie Coon, Michelle Monaghan, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Jason Isaacs, Blackpink‚Äôs Lisa and Natasha Rothwell‚Äîgets equal pay.

‚ÄúEveryone is treated the same on White Lotus,‚Äù David detailed in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter on April 2. ‚ÄúThey get paid the same, and we do alphabetical billing, so you‚Äôre getting people who want to do the project for the right reasons.‚Äù

According to THR, who also cited multiple sources, the show‚Äôs regular actors make ‚Äúroughly $40,000 an episode.‚Äù

PHOTOS The White Lotus Season 3 Photos

David noted this salary is ‚Äúnot negotiable,‚Äù and the team used their billing system‚Äîwhich they created to help fund the show‚Äôs first season in 2021‚Äîto make this price point. THR reports that season one‚Äôs stop in Hawaii cost ‚Äú$4 million an episode,‚Äù while its current third season‚Äôs budget in Thailand raised between ‚Äú$6 million and $7 million.‚Äù

And so far, this surprising fixed rate has worked for the popular series. The show‚Äôs casting director, Meredith Tucker, explained this approach has leveled the playing field.

‚ÄúIt makes it so much easier,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúYou tell people this is what it is. And some won‚Äôt do it ‚Äî and honestly, you can‚Äôt hold it against people who need to make a living. Our series regulars are pretty much doing this for scale.‚Äù

Elsewhere in the interview, White Lotus creator Mike White shared that Thailand wasn‚Äôt his dream location pick for season three. In fact, he had his eye on another spot in Asia.

‚ÄúOriginally, I wanted to shoot in Japan,‚Äù the 54-year-old director added. ‚ÄúI was in Thailand when my dad and I got eliminated from The Amazing Race ‚Äî two weeks in an elimination station with all these other bitter reality contestants, I was just like, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt ever want to come back here.‚Äù

But despite his apprehension, Mike noted HBO pushed for the country because they ‚Äúhad good tax incentives,‚Äù and the team visited Thailand shortly after.

Keep reading to fall in love with the show‚Äôs previous filming locations‚Ä¶

PHOTOSThe White Lotus, where youve seen the cast of The White Lotus season 3 before, key art

item.title: ‚ÄòWhite Lotus' composer quits over feud with Mike White
item.dc:creator: Tionah Lee | E! Online
Tionah Lee | E! Online

media:content.media:title: Los Angeles Premiere Of HBO Original Series ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 ‚Äì Arrivals
media:content.media:description: Mike White arrives at the Los Angeles Premiere Of HBO Original Series ‚ÄúThe White Lotus‚Äù Season 3 at Paramount Theatre on February 10, 2025 in Los Angeles, California.

item.excerpt: "White Lotus" composer Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer shared the reason he decided not to return for the HBO series, following a dispute with creator Mike White.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Crist√≥bal Tapia de Veer is no longer in harmony with “The White Lotus.”

The composer, who has worked on the HBO series for three seasons, revealed that after a dispute about the music on the show with creator Mike White, he won‚Äôt be checking in for the show‚Äôs fourth season.

‚ÄúI announced to the team a few months ago that I was not coming back, that I was leaving,‚Äù Tapia de Veer said during an interview with the New York Times published April 2. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt tell Mike for various reasons; I wanted to tell him just at the end for the shock and whatever. Except I told the whole editorial team and music editor and producer and all that, but I didn‚Äôt think that they were going to tell him. At some point he heard about that.‚Äù

According to Tapia de Veer, his and White‚Äôs beef began with the removal of the signature ‚Äúooh-loo-loo-loo‚Äù and ‚Äúooh-loo-loo-loos‚Äù from the opening credits score for this season which stars Patrick Schwarzenegger, Walton Goggins, Parker Posey and more. The move changed the theme song completely and left some fans of the series disappointed.

READ White Lotus Casting Director Says Actors Backed Out of Season 3 Over Incest Scenes

‚ÄúI texted the producer and I told him that it would be great to, at some point, give them the longer version with the ooh-loo-loo-loos, because people will explode if they realize that it was going there anyway,‚Äù Tapia de Veer said. ‚ÄúHe thought it was a good idea. But then Mike cut that ‚Äî he wasn‚Äôt happy about that.‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, at that point, we already had our last fight forever, I think,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúSo, he was just saying no to anything.‚Äù

E! News has reached out to Mike White and HBO for comment but has not heard back.

In the end, Tapia de Veer went along with White‚Äôs wishes, and didn‚Äôt let his original score disappear completely as he uploaded it to YouTube. The Emmy-winning musician offered his final thoughts about working with White, comparing his experience working with him to being in a rock band.

‚ÄúI was like, OK, this is like a rock band I‚Äôve been in before,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWhere the guitar player doesn‚Äôt understand the singer at all.‚Äù

The season finale of the most controversial installment of the franchise is set to air April 6 with an estimated runtime of 90 minutes. As for season four, which was announced in January, fans are going to have to wait to find out more details about the latest group of guests who will be checking into the luxury resort.

Keep reading for more about the real-life actors from “The White Lotus”‚Ä¶

item.title: Adam Devine details doctors saying he was dying due to past accident
item.dc:creator: Adrianne Reece | E! Online

item.excerpt: Adam¬†Devine, who was hit by a cement truck as a child, shared details about his health concerns and how his doctors connected it to his past accident.
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Adam Devine‚Äôs childhood accident still has a massive impact on his health.

The “Workaholics” actor, who was hit by a cement truck when he was 11 years old, recently revealed that a doctor told him the injuries he sustained from the accident are slowly killing him.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a nightmare,‚Äù Devine, 41, said in an April 2 episode of the In Depth With Graham Bensinger podcast. ‚ÄúI have spasms all over. For a while, [the doctors] told me I was dying‚Äîliterally, within this last year.‚Äù

The “Pitch Perfect” star‚Äîwho shares 12-month-old son Beau with wife Chloe Bridges‚Äîwas initially told he might be suffering from Stiff Persons Syndrome (SPS), a disorder where the ‚Äúmuscles gets so tight that you can no longer walk or move.‚Äù Of the condition, which Celine Dion was diagnosed with in 2022, he noted that this restrictive condition can impact the heart, causing it to ‚Äúbecome too tight to beat.‚Äù

PHOTOS: Adam DeVine & Chloe Bridges: Romance Rewind

‚ÄúThey told me that I had that a month before my son was born,‚Äù Devine added, before revealing the doctors walked back his diagnosis six months later. Despite that retraction, the Righteous Gemstones actor knew his health wasn‚Äôt in the greatest place. ‚ÄúI could only walk a few blocks before I‚Äôll get so tight that I couldn‚Äôt move anymore,” Devine said.

However, after a second opinion confirmed he didn‚Äôt have SPS, he was told that his recent muscle discomfort stemmed from his former encounter with the cement truck.

And now, Devine believes that his workout regimen‚Äîa mixture of cycling and doing CrossFit‚Äîhe started ‚Äúthree years ago‚Äù might‚Äôve triggered his mysterious symptoms.

‚ÄúI think I just got so tight,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúMy body has all these things that are a little wonky and a little wrong with it, that I just sort of snapped.‚Äù

The “Modern Family” alum has recalled details from that near-fatal moment over the years, including showing a throwback photo of him in the hospital as a kid on Instagram.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt walk for two years and had to completely relearn how to walk,‚Äù he reflected in the 2017 post. ‚ÄúThe nurses would always come in and have to adjust my legs, which were fully skin grafted and in traction. The pain was next level.‚Äù

item.title: David Schwimmer says he couldn't listen to ‚ÄòFriends' theme song. His daughter changed that

During an April 1 appearance on Matt Lucas and David Walliams‚Äô¬†‚ÄúMaking A Scene‚Äù podcast, Schwimmer explained that he didn‚Äôt like hearing the show‚Äôs signature tune, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Be There for You‚Äù by The Rembrandts, after the series was over. ‚ÄúI never watched the show after we finished it. For me, it‚Äôs like I did it. I‚Äôm moving on. I don‚Äôt really go back and revisit,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be really honest, there was a time, for quite a while, that just hearing...
item.description:
It took David Schwimmer a while to get into the “Friends” theme song after he heard it for so many years.

During an April 1 appearance on Matt Lucas and David Walliams’ “Making A Scene” podcast, Schwimmer explained that he didn’t like hearing the show’s signature tune, “I‚Äôll Be There for You” by The Rembrandts, after the series was over.

‚ÄúI never watched the show after we finished it. For me, it‚Äôs like I did it. I‚Äôm moving on. I don‚Äôt really go back and revisit,” he said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll be really honest, there was a time, for quite a while, that just hearing the theme song would really ‚Äî you know what I mean? I just had that reaction. I just had heard it so many times,” Schwimmer added. “And anytime you‚Äôd go on a show, or a talk show, or an interview, that would be your intro song. I just didn‚Äôt have the greatest response to it for a period of time.‚Äù

The star, who played Ross Geller in the hit ’90s sitcom, explained that things didn’t change for him until his 13-year-old daughter, Cleo, got into the show.

“At about … age 9, my kid discovered it and started watching it. And I’d be making breakfast, or whatever, and I’d hear my kid’s laughter. My whole relationship to that song and to the show changed again,” he said.

Schwimmer joked that “it is different when you don’t force a child to watch your work.”

“Friends” debuted in 1994, and it ended in 2004. The series starred Schwimmer, Jennifer Aniston, Lisa Kudrow, Courteney Cox, Matt LeBlanc and the late Matthew Perry as best friends living in New York City. The show, which immediately became popular among viewers, won numerous awards, including a 2002 Emmy for outstanding comedy series.

In September 2024, the show celebrated its 30th anniversary. In honor of the milestone, “Friends” creators David Crane and Marta Kauffman, along with executive producer Kevin Bright, spoke with NBC‚Äôs Joe Fryer about the show’s impact on younger generations.

‚ÄúWhen you have preteens coming up to you, telling you how much they love your show and asking you, ‚ÄòWill there be more episodes?‚Äô‚Äù Bright said.

‚ÄúWe get that a lot. I get emails about it all the time. And everybody has a great idea. And the great idea is their kids grown up doing a ‚ÄòFriends‚Äô show,‚Äù Kauffman said.

In response, Crane said, ‚ÄúOh, no, no, no, no.”

This story first appeared on TODAY.com. More from TODAY:

item.excerpt: Bruce Springsteen will open his vault in late June and debut 83 previously unreleased songs, the rock legend announced on Thursday.
item.description:
Bruce Springsteen will open his vault in late June and debut 83 previously unreleased songs, the rock legend announced on Thursday.

‚ÄúTracks II: The Lost Albums‚Äù will be comprised of seven “full-length records” and be available on June 27 through Sony Music, the E Street Band front man said in a statement.

‚Äú’The Lost Albums‚Äô were full records, some of them even to the point of being mixed and not released,‚Äù said Springsteen. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve played this music to myself and often close friends for years now. I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôll get a chance to finally hear them. I hope you enjoy them.‚Äù

The release appears to coincide with the upcoming film ‚ÄúDeliver Me From Nowhere,‚Äù a biopic about the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame icon starring “The Bear” actor Jeremy Allen White as The Boss.

item.excerpt: Kanye West revealed the state of his marriage with wife Bianca Censori in his one of his latest songs from his album WW3: "Bianca, I just want you to come back."
item.description:
Originally appeared on E! Online

Kanye West may be heading toward his second divorce.

The rapper confirmed speculation that he and his wife Bianca Censori are no longer on the same page after two years of marriage in his song, “BIANCA,” from his latest album “WW3.”

In the single’s lyrics published by Genius April 2, West pleas for his now-estranged wife to return on the heels of his recent controversial social media posts.

‚ÄúMy baby she ran away,” Ye raps, “But first she tried to get me committed / Not going to the hospital ‚Äôcause I am not sick I just do not get it.‚Äù

He adds, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs having a panic attack and she is not liking the way that I tweeted / Until Bianca‚Äôs back I stay up all night I‚Äôm not going to sleep / I really don‚Äôt know where she‚Äôs at.‚Äù

Music & Musicians Feb 6

Kanye West defends wife Bianca Censori's naked Grammys look

Grammy Awards Feb 2

Kanye West's wife Bianca Censori is completely naked at Grammys 2025

West’s latest song comes nearly two weeks after he fueled breakup rumors with a cryptic message about heartbreak.

“When you look at that betrayal list I realized I was just a part of peoples strategies,” he tweeted in part. “I took the word love to mean love when it really meant I love the opportunity.”

Ye continued, “I make decisions from my heart and mind. So when my heart is broken it breaks my mind too. That‚Äôs why I drank Henny to go to the awards that night. Just too many slaps in in the face.”

He accompanied the message with a screenshot of a redacted text exchange, saying he “would sign” something and saying he doesn’t “care” about the “terms proposed.”

READ Kanye West Includes His and Kim Kardashian‚Äôs Son Saint West in Video for Surprise New Album

Ye allegedly texted, “Just like to see people fulfill their dreams so they can s— on me later.”

The ‚ÄúRunaway‚Äù musician also fueled divorce rumors by wiping his Instagram and reportedly unfollowing Censori.

E! News has reached out to reps for West, 47, and Censori, 30, for comment and has not heard back.

Although West and Censori ‚Äî who tied the knot in 2022 ‚Äî turned heads at the 2025 Grammys in February with the architect’s show-stopping naked look, they‚Äôve since maintained a lower profile with their public appearances.

Instead, West ‚Äî who shares daughters North, 11, and Chicago, 7, along with sons Saint, 9, and Psalm, 5, with ex-wife Kim Kardashian ‚Äî appears to have been busy working on music with his kids. The rapper released his surprise album Bully March 19 featuring his eldest son in a short film introducing the project.

Saint wasn‚Äôt the only one of his kids to team up with their dad. Just days before dropping the visuals, he enlisted North‚Äôs help for his track ‚ÄúLonely Roads Still Go to Sunshine,‚Äù which also featured Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs.

The cameo with the rap mogul ‚Äî who is currently incarcerated on charges related to sex trafficking that he pleaded not guilty to ‚Äî appeared to clash with Kardashian‚Äôs beliefs on the decision.

West ‚Äî who has been vocal about his support for Combs ‚Äî shared a now-deleted alleged text conversation with his ex over trademarking North‚Äôs name.

“I asked u at the time if I can trademark her name,” Kardashian allegedly wrote in the texts. “You said yes. When she’s 18 it goes to her. So stop.”

She allegedly told West that she ‚Äúsent paperwork [sic] over so she wouldn’t be in the Diddy song to protect her.‚Äù

The messages infuriated West, who replied, ‚ÄúAmend it or I’m going to war and neither of us will recover from the public fallout. You’re going to have to kill me.‚Äù

For more of West‚Äôs romance with Censori, read on.

item.excerpt: Glen Powell spoke about reuniting with his "Anyone But You" co-star Sydney Sweeney recently at his sister's wedding in a TODAY exclusive on Wednesday.
item.description:
Glen Powell spoke about reuniting with his “Anyone But You” co-star Sydney Sweeney recently at his sister’s wedding in a TODAY exclusive on Wednesday.

The “Twisters” star celebrated the wedding of his younger sister, Leslie Powell, in his native Texas over the weekend and confirmed Sweeney was in attendance as he described her relationship with his sister.

“Timing is everything in this world, isn’t it? She and Syd are obviously great friends and it was a hell of a wedding,” Powell told Jenna Bush Hager and guest co-host Olivia Munn on TODAY with Jenna & Friends. “The Powells know how to do it right, so all the people that love her were there.”

Sweeney posed for a photo with Leslie Powell that was shared by wedding photographer Lyndi Stucky on her Instagram stories on March 30, according to E! News.

Glen Powell gave a speech at the wedding as his family enjoyed a happy weekend celebrating Leslie.

“It was just such a fun, rowdy wedding,” he said. “The Powells know how to crank it up.”

Powell, 36, served as a groomsman but joked that he was selected to deliver a speech because he was “probably the lowest liability in the family.” He called himself the “master of ceremonies of the wedding.”

The reunion with Sweeney, 27, caused a stir among fans, less than a year after the flirty press tour between the co-stars for “Anyone But You” sparked rumors of a budding romance.

In her opening monologue while hosting “Saturday Night Live” in March 2024, Sweeney addressed rumors that she cheated on her fianc√©, Jonathan Davino, with Powell while filming “Anyone But You.”

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs obviously not true. Me and my fianc√© produced the movie together and he was there the entire shoot,‚Äù Sweeney said of Davino.
